Stay comfortably in a luxuriously decorated, modern, 1 bedroom ground-floor street-level apartment in a building with residents above. Only a 5-15 min drive to downtown Ottawa and the main attractions (Rideau Canal, Historic Byward Market, University of Ottawa, Parliament Hill and museums). Thirsting for adventure and activity? It’s just a 2 minute walk to the Rideau River.

Questions? Just message me, B :)

The space
Our goal is to make your stay in Ottawa the best! Please contact me BEFORE or DURING your stay if any issues arise so we can help you enjoy your stay :)

The suite is always kept clean with it modern touches and high quality furnishings. It's the best place to come back to after a long day of travelling or sightseeing!

The suite is a high-end luxury suite. It comes fully furnished with 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom, a complete ready-to-use kitchen, in-unit washer and dryer, living room, and sofa bed.

neighborhood_overview:
Shopping and coffee shops are easily accessible with a short walk. Main tourist attractions are within a 5-15 min drive away.

See the welcome book for places to go, directions and flyers!
- 10 min walk away: Starbucks, Loblaws grocery store, BestBuy, Canadian Tire
- 5 min drive: Ottawa train station, Trainyards drive shopping centre, Walmart, St. Laurent Shopping Mall, Tim Hortons, LCBO liquor store and many restaurants.
- 5 - 10 min drive downtown: Rideau centre shopping mall, historic Byward Market, a variety of restaurants and bars, University of Ottawa
- Parliament Hill and surrounding museums and parks is only a 15 min drive away

Or take the scenic route and walk to downtown using the pedestrian bridge that crosses the Rideau River (bridge is only a 5 min walk away).

description:
Spacious, charming bachelor with character, right next to all the best that Ottawa has to offer! A 5min walk to Parliament, 10min walk to the Rideau Canal and Ottawa University, and a 15min walk to the Byward Market! Step out and experience the culinary delights of Elgin and Sparks street with its plethora of local cafes, restaurants, and shops! Come and enjoy Ottawa as it was meant to be!

The space
Make yourself at home in this fully furnished, warm studio apartment! The main bed is a double while the sofa also turns into a double bed. The kitchen has everything you need in order to prepare a delicious home-cooked meal, including free coffee and tea. Connect your laptop to the TV and stream movies via the included Wi-Fi. Or, if you're bored, play some board games!

Other things to note
When Checking out, please leave the keys on the table, the door can stay unlocked.
neighborhood_overview: Prime location in the epicenter of Ottawa adjacent to lively Elgin St but without the hustle and bustle. A short walk to all the major tourist attractions such as the Parliament, ByWard Market, and Rideau Canal!  A plethora of food choices for every budget, whether it's tacos at El Camino, fresh organic vegan delights at Pure Kitchen, or authentic Canadian poutine from the Chip Truck downstairs. Dining-in with quality produce at the Sobeys right around the corner is also an option. Pair it with some beer or wine from the Wine Shop! Feel like doing some shopping? The popular newly modernized Rideau Centre mall is a short walk away. Trendy night-life is easily accessible via eclectic Elgin St with a wide-selection of pubs, restaurants, and lounges catering to every type of taste! Then embrace the next morning with a cup of organic, fairly traded coffee at Happy Goat Coffee Company! Are you a student at Ottawa University? description:
Our home lies tucked away off the Rideau canal in a small Ottawa city neighbourhood.
Constructed in 1881, it exudes classic character with high ceilings and large windows yet modern elegance following a complete overhaul in 2017.

Homebodies ourselves, we opened up the space and added high-end amenities including a full “home chef” stainless steel kitchen, a tiled bathroom with a deep soaker tub and a living room with soft (but firm!) couches for easy lounging, coffee sipping and window gazing.

The space
Alongside The Rideau Canal, our neighbourhood is surrounded by nature. A quaint but mighty bakery is just steps away (for those coveted Ottawa Kettleman’s bagels!), along with fantastic restaurants and full shopping & entertainment a few blocks further in the Lansdowne Park area. Lansdowne is home to the annual Winterlude Festival as well as year-round football games, farmers markets, concerts and pop-up events.

Just off the Highway 417

description:
Cool space in the heart of the city. Walk to everything.
Once an architect’s office, this centrally located apartment has been tastefully converted to provide a quiet retreat for guests.

The space

Bright and cool with lots of of natural light looking into a peaceful garden.

neighborhood_overview:
The name of our neighbourhood is the Golden Triangle, it lies between Elgin Street and the Rideau Canal, and Laurier Avenue and the Queensway. It’s name comes from the shape of the neighbourhood, coming to a point when the Canal and Elgin Street meet.
Elgin is the main street in this area and is home to stores, boutiques and galleries, while surrounded by eating establishments, cafes, bars, and nightclubs.

description:
Our home is an upbeat and friendly place, located in the heart of the city where Wellington West meets Hintonburg, approximately 2.5 km west of the downtown core. We are walking distance to all of what our beautiful neighborhood has to offer: shops, cafe's local markets, pubs, and some of the best gelato in the city, parks, paths and the Ottawa river.

The space
Our home is a 2-story semi-detached. The room available is located on the second floor, facing the back of the house and is immediately beside the upstairs bathroom. There is a large screen TV with a DVD player, Netflix and an antenna for receivable local TV stations – we do not have cable TV in the house. The room is not large but fits a double sized bed, mini-fridge, and long dresser that the TV sits on, a small desk and stool, and a closet.

Wireless internet is available. Laundry is available to you in the basement.

Guest access
There are two shared entrances to the
neighborhood_overview: Wellington West and Hintonburg are bustling neighborhoods that have so much to offer from their local markets, to a plethora of restaurants, pubs, cafes, and shops, as well as parks, trails and the Ottawa River. neighborhood_overview:
Alta Vista is a highly residential neighbourhood with a strong community, several schools, churches, and community centres. It also has a vast amount of greenspace and parks, much of which is part of the Alta Vista Transportation Corridor Environment.

The OC Transpo Transitway also runs through Alta Vista, with two stations in the neighbourhood itself (Pleasant Park and Riverside) as well as two just outside (Billings Bridge and Smyth), serving as a vital transit link to the rest of the city.

The General Campus of the Ottawa Hospital, and The Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario are located just on the north side of Smyth Road, in Riverview, while the Riverside Campus of the Ottawa Hospital is located at Smyth and Riverside Drive. There are two shopping malls in and around Alta Vista: the Billings Bridge Plaza Shopping Centre at Bank Street and Riverside and the Elmvale Shopping Centre at St. Laurent and Smyth.

description:
This 100 year old building is located in the heart of Ottawa's Centretown and is just seconds from downtown, this apartment is clean, simple and couldn't be in a more perfect location. You will be one block away from Bank St. where you will find grocery stores, LCBO, coffee shops, boutiques, shopping stores and more! You'll love being seconds away from Chinatown, Little Italy, Byward Market, the Rideau Centre, Greyhound Station, Rideau canal and the Museum of Nature!

Can sleep up to 6 people.

The space
There are six apartments inside the building each with large covered balconies great for enjoying Ottawa's summer weather. The apartment is on the main floor on one of the calmer streets in the downtown core.

Guest access
Guests will have access to the entire two bedroom apartment which includes a large covered balcony. There are coin operated laundry machines available in the basement for your use($1.50 for washer and $1.50 for dr
neighborhood_overview: Centretown is a leafy residential district with a busy commercial core of clothes stores, brunch spots and lively Irish pubs on Elgin and Bank streets. The Rideau Canal is popular for its waterside trail and becomes an ice-skating rink in winter, while Dundonald and Jack Purcell parks are dotted with monuments and public artwork. The Canadian Museum of Nature has exhibits on Arctic fossils and polar bears.

Safe and happy travels!

The space

A wonderful living room area which offers a Smart TV that allows Netflix and YouTube. Additionally, a modern kitchen with Granite Countertops, Stainless Steel Fridge/Stove, Washer/Dryer, fully renovated bathroom as well as access to a balcon
neighborhood_overview:
THIS is where you want to be! Right on the bustling Rideau Street and near everything Ottawa has to offer! It doesn't get any better than this.

Museums, museums, and more museums. This location has over a dozen museums in proximity (nature, war, postal, history, science & technology, agriculture, civilization, etc.)

Or, spend the day relaxing in the largest thermal spa in North America; Nordik Spa-Nature, situated only 10 minutes way.

Perhaps you'd like to try your luck against the one-armed-bandits? You are a short 15 minutes drive to the "Lac-Lemay" Casino in Hull!

Then, finish off by watching the sunset on a hilltop in the Gatineau Park.

These are just a few suggestions of activities to do during your time here. Once you book your stay with us, be sure to check out the Guestbook for more details and other "MUST-DO" items in Ottawa.

description:
Fully furnished, clean, air conditioned town house in central Old Ottawa South. Minutes to great shopping and dining, highly walkable and close to the river and the Rideau Canal. Public transit at the door. 15 minutes to downtown. Close to General Campus of Ottawa Hospital and CHEO; and close to Carleton University.

The space
Two bedroom townhouse in once of Ottawa's best neighbourhoods! One king (brand new mattress) and one double; all linens, towels provided. Fully up to date and modern bathroom with walk-in shower, plus additional downstairs powder room. Fully equipped eat-in kitchen; electric appliances, including stove, fridge, microwave, toaster oven, coffee maker, blender, kettle etc. Living/dining room with gas fireplace. TV in separate room on lower floor, also extensive library. Wifi available. Beautiful urban oasis off the back deck and lovely English garden. One parking space in driveway. No smoking. Not suitable for pets or small children. Man
neighborhood_overview: Situated in a vibrant, friendly neighbourhood, this home is the perfect getaway at any time of year;  Winterlude, Tulip Festival, Summer in the Capital or wonderful Fall colours everywhere. Easy walking distance to coffee shops, gelato café, bakery, restaurants and late-opening drug store. Close to Carleton University and all the kid-friendly activities of the local parks. Excellent bike baths and running trails nearby. Public transit at the door for the National Arts Centre and many of Ottawa's national museums.

neighborhood_overview: Centretown is a leafy residential district with a busy commercial core of clothes stores, brunch spots and lively Irish pubs on Elgin and Bank streets. The Rideau Canal is popular for its waterside trail and becomes an ice-skating rink in winter, while Dundonald and Jack Purcell parks are dotted with monuments and public artwork. The Canadian Museum of Nature has exhibits on Arctic fossils and polar bears.

Use of the public areas of the house (kitchen, living room, back yard, deck, patio, pool). Designated supplies (coffee, tea, condiments) provided. House was part of city gardening tour in 2017. description:
Welcome to our Downtown Getaway in the heart of Canada's Capital.

Newly furnished and renovated, this listing is centrally located near Parliament Hill, Carleton University, the Byward Market and Lansdowne Park, aa well as dining, transit and shopping.

In addition to the great location, we provide unlimited WIFI, premium cable TV, complimentary coffee and CENTRAL air conditioning.

We offer on site-laundry, and all the comfort and amenities of home.

Book with us today and enjoy your stay!

The space
Located in Downtown Ottawa, we are just minutes away from Parliament Hill, the Rideau Canal, Byward Market, Carleton University and much more!

Guest access
Guests have a private entrance and full access to the entire apartment

Other things to note
We are experienced AirBNB hosts who take pride in offering premium properties at fair value.

description:
This newly renovated, cozy, one-bedroom apartment in a 100 year old house can accommodate up to two guests. The unique house, hip neighbourhood, and proximity to the downtown core, the federal government campus Tunney's Pasture, and the Ottawa Hospital Civic Campus make this a perfect home away from home.

The space
The unit is located on the first floor of a two-storey duplex house. It is an individual and private unit that has just recently been fully renovated.

The main entrance into the house is a common entrance for both the ground level unit as well as this first level unit. Each apartment further has its own entrance with a lock. Guests are able to access this unit by walking up one flight of stairs.

Guests have full and private access to everything in this unit, including a spacious bedroom with a queen-size bed, modern kitchen, bathroom with a shower, and a cozy living room / office space. Please note that this unit used to be a tw
neighborhood_overview:
Hintonburg is a lively and hip neighbourhood. Special features that are just a few minutes away by foot from the apartment include:

1. Wellington Street: home to lots of restaurants and cute stores. A small grocery store is walking distance to the apartment. Large chain grocery stores are better reached by bike, bus, or car.

2. The Parkdale Market: this lively market is open daily from April to November, 6am to 6pm. You can find an array of fresh fruit, vegetables, and plants there.

3. Laroche Park: offers a large open field with two baseball diamonds, a children's play area, and an off-leash dog park.

4. Gatineau River Trail: you can enjoy a relaxing walk, run, bike ride, or (in the winter) cross-country skiing along the river. You can also use the trail for a scenic commute to downtown.

description:
This cozy 2 storey studio apartment is in the heart of the vibrant neighbourhood of Little Italy. Steps from restaurants, bakeries & cafes. The space is peaceful & bright with a galley kitchen on 1st floor & living & bedroom space on 2nd floor. On a street framed by a multi-use pathway. Close to Chinatown & Hintonburg. 2min walk to Dow's Lake & Rideau Canal. Bike, walk, O-Train or bus to Carleton U or Ottawa U, Civic Hospital, or downtown. Note there is a security camera monitoring the entrance.

The space
This cozy two-storey studio apartment on the south side of a residential house is in the heart of the vibrant neighbourhood of Little Italy. Steps from tons of restaurants, bakeries and cafes. The space is peaceful and bright with a galley kitchen on the main floor and a living and bedroom space on the upper floor with brand new furnishings. The space includes wifi, air conditioning and a shared backyard. Comfortable queen bed and a futon for one child. Adults w
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Ottawa's Little Italy neighbourhood. Tree-lined streets, award winning restaurants featuring global cuisines and independent boutiques makes this one of Ottawa's most interesting and vibrant neighbourhoods. Venture along the picturesque cycling paths along the Ottawa River and the Rideau Canal pathways. Enjoy the scenery at Dow's Lake or head close by to visit the world renowned War Museum. Rent canoes, kayaks and stand up paddleboards at Dow's Lake, and explore the city from an entirely different vantage point! Roundtrip would take a few hours so is definitely a fun way to spend the day.

description:
This beautiful property is a large duplex with two separate units; one upstairs and one downstairs. It's ideal for large groups or families. This large century home has parking for up to four vehicles, 6 bedrooms, 8 beds and two sofa beds. All furnishings are brand new as of May 2018. Located on a quiet tree lined street and only steps away from the heart of the Byward Market. Walking distance to Parliament, The National Gallery, NAC, Rideau Centre and all the best shops, bars and restaurants.

The space
This listing is located on the ground level of a duplex. There is a second floor apartment as well. Both units have their own separate entrances and lots of privacy. These are not shared spaces. The main floor unit is quite spacious with three bedroom and a large dining and living room area. The kitchen is fully stocked with a dishwater, microwave, oven and washer and dryer. All listings have their own kitchenwear, linens and towels.

Guest access
neighborhood_overview:
Join some friends for brunch, lunch or dinner, and then hit the shops for the highest quality food products, fashions and cutting edge trends. See and be seen until the wee hours at one of our hip nightspots.
Morning, noon and night the ByWard Market has something just for you.

Established by Lt-Col. John By in 1826, the ByWard Market is one of Canada's oldest and largest public markets. The legendary builder of the Rideau Canal, Colonel By himself laid out the street plan of the Market, designating George Street and York Street to be extra wide to accommodate the creation of a public market and gathering place.

Within an area roughly four blocks square, you'll find museums, cafés, specialty food shops, boutiques, galleries, restaurants, pubs, hair & aesthetics salons and more! Easily accessible on foot, by transit or by car, the ByWard Market offers a unique experience for all.

description:
This bright and airy apartment is on the top floor of our Westboro home. You'll have your own entrance and tons of privacy. We have everything you need, including a bodum and Nespresso coffee maker in the kitchen to start your mornings off right, and towels, soap and shampoo in the bathroom, plus an in-suite washer and dryer.

The bus stops right across the street and will get you downtown in 15 minutes, or there's parking available if you're driving.

We're confident you'll enjoy your stay!

The space
Whether you're coming to Ottawa for business or to visit family and friends, this bright, second-floor studio is just what you're looking for.

The space is ideal for one or two people, but can sleep three in a pinch with the pull-out single bed in the love seat.

The brand-new queen-size bed is super comfortable.

The kitchen has all the dishes, accessories and amenities you need, including a toaster, kettle, mi
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in a lovely neighbourhood just west of downtown, nestled between Westboro and Wellington West. You'll find a ton of great shops, restaurants and cafés just a short walk away. It's very close to Island Park, the Civic Hospital, the Royal Ottawa and Tunney's Pasture.

More information
There are two grocery stores, two liquor stores and a pharmacy within a 5 minute walk from the house, which is incredibly convenient.

This comfortable 1 bedroom apartment is close to all the action in trendy Hintonburg. Enjoy cafes, restaurants, bars, live music & theater, boutiques and take-out food & groceries nearby.

Newly renovated, this apartment features a lovely verandah, and a living room that can be used as a second bedroom with a sofa bed. Clean & Green: we use environmentally friendly cleaning products. PLEASE SEE BELOW - PROTECTION DURING COVID-19.

Bikes available to rent. Walk to Civic Hospital/Heart Institute

The space
A squeaky clean, bright 1-bedroom apartment, furnished with character, comfort and quality.

- The bedroom features a super comfortable queen sized bed, antique vanity and mirror, closet for putting away your clothes and a bed bench.
- The living room is furnished with a stunning red couch, Hans Wegner wicker chair, 42-inch wall-mounted TV and desk. This room can be used as a second bedroom as it has a door and the pull-out c
neighborhood_overview:
Hintonburg is a safe and friendly neighbourhood – and the trendiest place in town. Within a few blocks you will find a selection of cafés, restaurants, pubs, microbreweries, live music and theatre. If you like to stay fit you will appreciate the nearby yoga studio, fitness studios and city-run gym and pool. Close by are parks, bike trails and cross-country skiing. You could learn to sew, knit, do pottery or blow glass nearby. In fact, you could enjoy an action- packed vacation and never leave the neighbourhood! Guests feel like instant locals and we provide all the information you need to do so.

There is plenty of choice in restaurants and cafes nearby for all budgets. If you are eating in, you will find grocery stores at the top of the street, including the Hintonburg Marché providing deli meat & cheese, local produce and healthy take out prepared meals; Bread by Us for fresh baked bread & pastries. The LCBO down the street provides wine, beer and spirits.

neighborhood_overview:
My Apartment is located in the Downtown Glebe, a local, hip and nostalgic neighbourhood bustling with local businesses and an irresistible trendy vibe.

It is on a quiet residential street yet very close to everything, including parliament/byward market. Great restaurants, bars, coffee shops, museums - all nearby.

Steps to Lansdowne Park/TD Place Stadium if your coming to watch your favorite sports team. Lansdowne Park features everything from relaxation to recreation. Landsdowne Park is a must see destination for tourists, a hub to connect neighbourhoods, a quite oasis, a destination for shopping, restaurants and entertainment. It has something to offer for everyone to enjoy.

Steps to the Canal - beautiful trail for a morning run and a refreshing bike ride. Make sure to check out the Byward Market and Parliament in downtown core, minutes away!

Peloton House is a stunning apartment on the ground floor of a lovingly renovated historic 1867 build. Located in the central, old-world Heritage Conservation District of New Edinburgh; a stone's throw from rivers, parks, the Governor General's residence, the Byward market and the National Gallery. A high-end apartment that combines the freshness of modern design with period details and original artwork from throughout North America.

The space
This one-bedroom apartment has been lovingly renovated and professionally decorated in neutral tones. It has all the amenities for your comfort: a king size tempurpedic bed, 1,000 thread count egyptian cotton sheets, and a giant Smart TV. It also has a fabulous backyard for summer and a ski rack and easy access to Gatineau Park in the winter. However, it is a historic space and has some quirks characteristic of period homes. Perfectly located in the heart of Ottawa's Glebe, this space provides a private, double-bed with in-room coffee-carafe, Wifi.

It provides parking for one vehicle, a secure-entrance building and a secure, private space, and access to all common spaces.

Common spaces include the bathroom, and kitchen, as well as the dining and sitting rooms.

Public transit stops are footsteps from the building's main entrance; taxi's as well as Uber's are easily accessible also.

Superb Location!

The space

Guest access

Other things to note

neighborhood_overview:
The Glebe is a relaxed and historic neighbourhood of shops, restaurants, pubs and services along Bank Street just south of Highway 417, otherwise known as the Queensway.

Bank Street, travels north/south through the heart of the Glebe; the Rideau Canal borders the eastern edge of this beautiful community. During the winter months, Ottawa hosts the world's longest skating rink on the frozen canal.

South on Bank Street, where the Glebe ends, is Landsdowne Park and TD Place Stadium.

A revamped historical site, Lansdowne is a new idea for a historic site - less than a decade old - it's transformation did not come without controversy or challenge.

One of Ottawa's newest entertainment districts, it hosts pro-sports games, major concerts, has a busy nightlife, numerous eateries, businesses, a Cineplex VIP Theatre, as well as unique events, various festivals, and a year-round farmers market.

description:
Newly Renovated 2-bedroom apartment, new kitchen, , bathroom, and hardwood floor. 10min walk to Ottawa University, Byward Market and to the Parliament buildings. Great location to explore Downtown Ottawa, 24/7 Loblaws grocery store across the Street. Laundry facility on site. Parking is free on city street between 5:30pm and 8am and free all day on Sundays. Also, private parking is just across the street from the apartment at Loblaws grocery store. they're open 24/7 and charge for 9$/day.

The space
Located in the heart of the Downtown Ottawa...great location to explore the city's main tourists' attractions on foot...

Other things to note
Very easy self-check-in and check-out process...this gives you the flexibility to check in anytime after 3pm and I am only 5min walk from the building.

description:
Comfortable accommodations with privacy.

The space
This surprisingly spacious 2 bedroom comes with a small studio next to the Queen bedroom.
We have a Smart TV in the living room and a smaller unit can be provided for the bedroom.
You're welcome to play the piano in the living room. It is electronic, so please keep adjust the volume to a reasonable level especially at night.
Breakfast is included, but what this means is that I provide basics such as bread, tea/coffee, milk, sugar, cereal, eggs, oatmeal, BUT you are responsible for preparing your own breakfast.
You may use the kitchen to prepare your lunches and dinners. I'll make space in the fridge and cupboard for your foodstuff.
I expect that you clean your dishes/glasses/cups/utensils and cookware after meals. There is no maid service here.
Please treat my home with respect and if something doesn't work or breaks, let me know as soon as possible.
I am usually here, but I so
neighborhood_overview:
This calm neighbourhood was built after WW2 and some of my neighbours have lived here for 30 and even 50 years. It's a safe community with 2 elementary schools within 2 blocks in each direction.

We are a few blocks to Beechwood Avenue where you'll find plenty of shops, cafes, pharmacy, grocery store (Metro), and the favourite Scone Witch for a great weekend brunch.

The Walking Score is very high with the Rideau River park just around the corner. This is a great place to get away from noise and the daily stresses of life. Walk or bike on the trail and you'll find the Rideau Sports Centre about 10 minutes away. This is a public sports club for tennis, futsal, yoga etc. You'll find it right at the Adawe pedestrian bridge which takes you across the Rideau River to Sandy Hill and then straight up to the uOttawa campus.

How much more central can you be?

The space features modern finishes, including insulated laminate floors, IKEA kitchen, stainless steel appliances, and high-efficiency washer and dryer. It is private and separated from the upstairs.

description:
Located 12 minutes walk to the Ottawa Civic Hospital (Heart Institute) and 2 minutes to the Royal Ottawa Hospital! Charming war time home with modern renovations.

We live in a very friendly tree lined neighbourhood and in summer have a beautiful yard to relax in with our dog! You’ll have access to a kitchen and a shared bathroom.

Note that we have a 2nd room with a queen bed for rent also.

The space
Large bedroom with large windows that open and room darkening curtains. Desk, lots of light, dresser and closet with hangers. All linens supplied.

Ironing board and iron in room. We've also provided you with your own fridge in your room! Upon your arrival, you will find all the information you need in the house manual such as the Wi-Fi code and how to get around town!

Our house is 1.5 storeys - on the top floor are the two guest rooms; on the main floor is the bathroom and kitchen; our room and laundry are both downstairs.<
neighborhood_overview:
We are located 8km west of the Byward Market in a cute, safe neighbourhood. There is a Shoppers Drug Mart nearby for convenience supplies including food; 3 banks within walking distance, health food store, fast food. Grocery Store about a 15 minute walk.

Within a 30 minute walk you have the hot neighbourhoods of Westboro and Hintonburg - enough restaurants and shops to keep you very busy!

30 minute walk to the east (you can also take a bus) is Preston Street, which is Little Italy and has several bars and restaurants.

At the house I have a list of unique cafe's you may wish to visit and/or study at!

Warm, secluded, cozy Cabin (w/wood stove) nestled in the Marlborough forest outside Ottawa - for the ultimate Zen experience w/private trails through woods, past ponds & meadow. Peace, serenity & tranquility make for a rejuvenating stay. Find yourself or lose yourself :) Cabin is 4 min walk from house. Electricity (one 3-plug outlet: Light/Fridge/hot plate/heater). No running water - Drinking water & bio toilet only. Fire pit available. Firewood $8/day or bring your own

The space
Country feel within the capital - just 30 minutes from downtown. Breakfast (extra) can be provided in beautiful setting. Parking 4 minute walk from the cabin. No noise, you'll be getting the best good night's sleep ever. No magnetic fields (but there is phone reception). Enjoy the rustic country feel and the warmth of the wood stove in cooler weather. Please be aware you have to carry your personal items from the house to the cabin. If it’s rainy or spring/autumn rubber boots are prerequ

description:
Our cottage is a cozy three bedroom cottage with beds for 8 people. It is an open concept newly renovated space with spectacular views of the Ottawa River and Gatineau Hills. There is a sandy beach that extends for 5 klms to the east that allows for long walks. The water is shallow and sandy bottom which is great for children. The sun sets directly on the beach in the summer which makes for spectacular sunsets.

The space
The cottage is located on a quiet stretch of the beach. The beach is public access however we are at the far end of Constance Bay with not a lot of traffic at all. There is a gas BBQ , fire pit and 2 kayaks for use.

Guest access
Guest will have access to the entire cottage and chain link enclosure for beach toys.
The garage and shed are not for guest use.
neighborhood_overview:
Constance Bay is an adorable little beach town about 20 minutes from Kanata. It has an LCBO/BEER/Store and Pizza Place for your convenience. The Lighthouse Diner has great food that you can enjoy dining in or take out.
The Point is a great place for wings, pub food and a great beach for swimming.
The closest grocery store is Sobeys on March Rd 20 minutes away in Kanata .
This is cottage country so WIFI runs about 5 mbps at maximum download speeds which is much slower than the high speed internet you would find in the city. We do also have unlimited WIFI and brand new smart TV. We do not have a landline phone but cell reception is good.

neighborhood_overview:
Check out my GUIDEBOOK for suggestions to restaurants & MORE!

Sandy Hill is a great neighborhood located just East of downtown Ottawa. It borders on the Byward Market and Centertown. Those two neighbourhoods are a bit more lively, while Sandy Hill retains more of a residential feel. But they’re just a stone’s throw away, so you’re never far removed from the action on the weekend.

It’s ideally located with easy access to the top spots in Ottawa, including the Byward Market, the Canal, Centretown, and the large shopping complex. The community is highly diverse, comprising of students, middle class families, and highly affluent residents. Speaking of which, if you’re currently attending classes or planning on attending school, Sandy Hill is the best neighbourhood to visit the University of Ottawa.

There are 4 bedrooms. Hardwood floors throughout. Whether you're visiting for business or for leisure, look no further.

The space

The main living area, kitchen and dining area is on the second floor, with amazing views of Strathcona Park and the Ottawa river. There is a balcony by the kitchen as well. The 3rd floor has 3 bedrooms. The Master bedroom has a King size bed, bathtub and an ensuite bathroom and walk-in closet, and the othe
neighborhood_overview:
Sandy hill is situated within walking distance of the ByWard Market, so shares many services and shops of the market, including grocery stores and the transitway. Located close to downtown, Sandy Hill has excellent public transportation, a large shopping complex, and many schools to serve its families. Sandy Hill is bounded by Rideau-Besserer-Daly Avenue on the north, both Highway 417 and Nicholas Street to the south, the Rideau River to the east, and the Rideau Canal to the west. This neighbourhood includes the community of Strathcona Heights and the University of Ottawa.
As a residential community, Sandy Hill dates back to the 1870s and was the wealthiest and most prestigious neighbourhood in the Ottawa area up until the early 20th century. Some of the neighbourhood’s notable locations include Laurier House, the residence of Prime Ministers Sir Wilfred Laurier and William Lyon Mackenzie-King, and the house of WWI ace Billy Bishop, which was later inhabited by another Prime Mini

You'll love being seconds away from Chinatown, Little Italy, Byward Market, the Rideau Centre, Greyhound Station, Rideau canal and the Museum of Nature!

Can sleep up to 7 people.

This unique apartment is owned by Sandy and Angela who have had this building for over 40 years now! There are six apartments inside the building each with large covered balconies great for enjoying Ottawa's summer weather. The apartment is on the 3rd floor on one of the calmer streets in the downtown core.

Guest access
Guests will have access to the entire three bedroom apartment which includes a large covered balcony. There are c

The Rideau Canal is popular for its waterside trail and becomes an ice-skating rink in winter, while Dundonald and Jack Purcell parks are dotted with monuments and public artwork. The Canadian Museum of Nature has exhibits on Arctic fossils and polar bears.

neighborhood_overview:
You are in the heart of an established centuries old area called the Glebe, a very hip and urban neighborhood that really has all you need for entertainment & shopping. Lined by beautiful Victorian style homes with “Ma and Pa” shops from boutiques, bakeries, grocers, banks, pharmacies, specialty cafés, fine dining, casual dining, and pubs.
You are a five minute walk to the scenic Rideau canal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where you can bike/walk/run along tree-lined paths or ice-skate in the winter along the longest skating canal in the world.
Parliament Hill is close enough to walk but easy public transit on OC-Transpo (a two-minute walk) will have you there in ten minutes.

description:
Centrally located home 2 blocks from hospital, large park, fruit and flower markets and main streets. Immaculate Cape Cod style home on a quiet street with working fireplace, piano, private garden, large deck and parking for 3 cars.

The space
Two large bedrooms, full kitchen and living room with wood burning fireplace, cozy den with HDTV TV and Wifi, lower level living room with pull out couch, washer/dryer. Home is equipped with state of the art air purifying system. I do have two cats - mature and well behaved.

Guest access
Linens and towels provided.
neighborhood_overview: The Civic Hospital area is part of the original City of Ottawa.  My street is extremely secure and quiet as it is close to the hospital and fire station.   The Experimental Farm is 3 blocks away and there are two local parks that are great for dogs and kids.    You are also two blocks from the Queensway, the main artery that runs to downtown.      There are two large shopping malls less than 2k away.

description:
Welcome to my home! I have a spacious 1 bedroom available for rent. The bathroom, living room and kitchen will be shared. There's plenty of parking available and a large back yard with a deck and BBQ. There's an additional small cot (1 person) available if needed.

The space
Upon arrival, you will receive 2 keys - 1 for the bedroom and 1 for the main door.
Your bedroom will also have the following:
- 1x Double sized bed with bedding provided
- 1x computer desk and chair
- 1x floor length mirror
- coat hangers
- wash cloth and towel
- extra blankets
- stand up fan
- dresser
- trash can

Guest access

- upstairs bathroom
- basement bathroom
- kitchen
- living/dining room
- laundry (basement)

Outside Communal space:
- backyard and deck
- driveway

Welcome to Ottawa Centretown - the heart of the City.

Once you park your car in the designated underground parking spot, you’ll take your chic elevator through the chic building we call Central II.

You are several stories up with an unobstructed view of the western sunset. The unit is fully furnished with a queen bed and double futon in the den. We have wifi and cable!

The building hosts an outdoor pool - two gyms - two party rooms. You live above an LCBO, across the street from a bakery, shawarma shoppe, dominos pizza in one direction.

In the other direction across the street is a Starbucks, wheelhouse spin studio and yoga studio.

Diagonal to you is the Esso Station and a Timmies! Highway access is two blocks away.

The sun-filled apartment is the entire main ground floor (800 sq ft) of this century old Glebe home. Everything is clean and new. A large parking spot is provided at the rear of the property. Special rates apply for guests staying longer than 28 days.

The space
Brand new addition in 1995 and renovated in 2018. This home has lots of natural light and private access. Smart TV has NETFLIX capability with your login. neighborhood_overview:
You are in the heart of an established centuries old area called the Glebe, a very hip and urban neighborhood that really has all you need for entertainment & shopping. Lined by beautiful Victorian style homes with “Ma and Pa” shops from boutiques, bakeries, grocers, banks, pharmacies, specialty cafés, fine dining, casual dining, and pubs.
You are a five minute walk to the scenic Rideau canal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where you can bike/walk/run along tree-lined paths or ice-skate in the winter along the longest skating canal in the world.
Parliament Hill is close enough to walk but easy public transit on OC-Transpo (a two-minute walk) will have you there in ten minutes.
The Lansdowne development has brought a new vibe with trendy nightclubs and restaurants, green space with skatepark and play structures, a Whole Foods grocery store and a modern theatre build around the Lansdowne stadium which is home to the Ottawa Red Blacks (CFL), the Ottawa Fury (ASL) and t

In addition many of the city’s hospitals operate in the Alta Vista area (The Ottawa Hospital General Campus, The Ottawa Hospital Riverside Campus, The Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario (CHEO), The Ottawa Cancer Center. The Ottawa Health Sciences Center)

neighborhood_overview:
Morgan's Grant (pop. 8,000) is a suburban neighbourhood located in Kanata, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. It is north of the Kanata North Business Park, west of March Road, and north of Terry Fox Drive.

Morgan's Grant has several recreational pathways, a number of playgrounds, a public elementary school, a French public elementary school, and a variety of services. A shopping plaza at the corner of March Rd. and Klondike Rd. features a walk-in clinic, dental office, a selection of fast-food establishments, a Shoppers Drug Mart, and a TD Canada Trust. ( WikiPedia )

description:
Bright, modern two-bedroom loft. King, Double and sofa bed. Vaulted ceilings. Separate entrance.
Quiet residential street in the heritage neighbourhood of New Edinburgh. Walk to embassies, Global Affairs Canada, restaurants, shops, and parks. Steps to Governor General's official residence. Blocks from the Prime Minister's residence. Short ride to Byward Market, National Gallery, National Arts Centre, downtown - or a pleasant walk along Sussex Drive.

The space
Comfortable self-contained loft space in a residential neighbourhood. Supermarket, banks, pharmacy, bookshop, art gallery, bakeries, coffee shops, restaurants and pubs are all within walking distance. Also several private schools and churches are similarly situated nearby.
neighborhood_overview: After years of living in different areas of Ottawa, we have fond memories of New Edinburgh.  Our children attended a nearby school and spent innumerable hours after-school at the local ballet academy.  We divided our time between the beautiful running paths alongside the river and the welcoming local pubs.  Our favourite local bakery, The Scone Witch, began in the corner of a nearby house, which now houses the Union Street Kitchen and Yoga Studio.  Although work has taken us away, we maintain our home for our own return visits and we are very happy to make it available to visitors, because we want to share the feeling of living in a warm, familiar setting that we are certain others will appreciate.

description:
Welcoming guests of 28 days or more: This gorgeous fully renovated (for AirBnB) house is within a 1 minute walk to trendy Bank Street and a five minute walk to Lansdowne Park, theatres, and wonderful nightlife. The sun-filled apartment is the entire second floor (500 sq ft) of this century old Glebe home. As a bonus, there is a large attic space that contains a work desk and a day queen bed. Everything is clean and new.

The space
Brand new addition in 1995 and full renovated in 2018. This home has lots of natural light and private access. Smart TV has NETFLIX capability with your login. There is a punch code lock on the door which allows access anytime from check in to check out. There is a small deck off the front of the house. Street parking is available or the city has a parking garage two doors down with overnight parking for $14 (as of Sep 19). New Ottawa rules on minimum length of stay. Please contact us for more information.

Guest
neighborhood_overview:
You are in the heart of an established centuries old area called the Glebe, a very hip and urban neighborhood that really has all you need for entertainment & shopping. Lined by beautiful Victorian style homes with “Ma and Pa” shops from boutiques, bakeries, grocers, banks, pharmacies, specialty cafés, fine dining, casual dining, and pubs.
You are a five minute walk to the scenic Rideau canal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where you can bike/walk/run along tree-lined paths or ice-skate in the winter along the longest skating canal in the world.
Parliament Hill is close enough to walk but easy public transit on OC-Transpo (a two-minute walk) will have you there in ten minutes.
The Lansdowne development has brought a new vibe with trendy nightclubs and restaurants, green space with skatepark and play structures, a Whole Foods grocery store and a modern theatre build around the Lansdowne stadium which is home to the Ottawa Red Blacks (CFL), the Ottawa Fury (ASL) and t

Your perfect private suite in the heart of Carlington. Get anywhere in Ottawa in a 15 minute drive, or grab the bus from right outside the home with busses that can get you to the heart of downtown Ottawa in less than 30 minutes. Close to the Canal, Dows Lake, Little Italy, Chinatown, Downtown Ottawa, the trendy Westboro and Hintonburg neighborhoods, the Experimental Farms, Canada's Parliament, and many restaurants, museums, malls, and parks.

Coffee and tea included!

The space
A newly renovated, very well lit basement apartment with large windows and its own private entrance and parking spot. You have a fully stocked kitchen, eating and lounging space, a private bedroom with a queen sized bed, and a private full bathroom. We also have two, stack-able, single beds in the lounging space that makes the space great for groups up to four people, but we can try to accommodate more if requested.

Guest access
No washer and dryer access
neighborhood_overview: The historic Carlington neighborhood is a quiet little part of town as close to downtown as you can get, while still feeling like you're not in the thick of the city. Since the space available to the guest is the whole lower level, it is quite spacious.

The space
The spaces are private and spacious on the lower level. The neighbourhood is very quiet except for the occasional snowplow in winter.

Guest access
The lower level of the home provides bedroom and living areas. There is a small toilet on the landing or the main floor washroom is also available. The tidy and clean lower level laundry room has a new vanity available for your use. A shower is only available in the main bathroom. neighborhood_overview:
Located on a side street in the village of Metcalfe, you have easy walking distance to a small general store called Metcalfe Variety, the local post office, a hair dressing salon, a City of Ottawa Public Library, arena and community centre, a curling rink, the famous Metcalfe Farmer's Market in the summer, and quiet residential streets or country roads to go for walks or a bike ride. There is a restaurant in town approximately 1 km away close to Bank Street. Tim Hortons is available in Russell or Embrun. Large grocery store in Greely or Russell.
There is a paved, level and shaded bicycle trail in Russell (10 minute by car) leading to Embrun which is very nice to use for walks or rides. It is a converted rail track.

Museums, museums, and more museums. This location has over a dozen museums in proximity (nature, war, postal, history, science & technology, agriculture, civilization, etc.)

Or, spend the day relaxing in the largest thermal spa in North America; Nordik Spa-Nature, situated only 10 minutes way.

Perhaps you'd like to try your luck against the one-armed-bandits? You are a short 15 minutes drive to the "Lac-Lemay" Casino in Hull!

Then, finish off by watching the sunset on a hilltop in the Gatineau Park.

These are just a few suggestions of activities to do during your time here. Once you book your stay with us, be sure to check out the Guestbook for more details and other "MUST-DO" items in Ottawa.

description:
Welcome to New Edinburgh! One of Ottawa's oldest and most character filled neighbourhoods. Home to the Prime Minister, Governor General and countless other foreign dignitaries and local notables. The hood is known for its amazing green spaces and attractions such as the GG's grounds, Rideau Falls, The Royal Canadian Geographic Society and Stanley Park. Stay in a modern addition to a house from 1870 in a dedicated guest suite. Only 15 minutes walk from the Market or drive from Gatineau Park.

The space
Private space consists of a bedroom, bonus room and bathroom. Very comfortable bed. Dedicated thermostat and air conditioning within space. Mini fridge and kettle. Closet and chest of drawers. Laptop table and chair. Loads of natural light. Large fenced in back yard. Dog friendly.
Parking available in rear laneway.

Guest access
Feel free to enjoy the backyard as well as the suite
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood features all amenities (grocery, post office, pharmacy, restaurants, pubs, gym, dry cleaner, banks, gas, shops, etc.) 10 minutes walk away on beechwood avenue. Continental breakfast (juice, coffee, tea, milk, cereal, yoghurt, toast, bread, jam, peanut butter, muffins occasionally, etc) - is available 7-12noon. My friend, Phil, (and his miniature poodle, Junior) live in the basement and occasionally use the ground floor.

The space
We are located in downtown Ottawa, right on the Rideau Canal, close to many locations of interest: the canal, banks, groceries, pharmacies, museums, restaurants, bars, cafes, theaters, embassies, gyms, Chinatown, Little Italy, Universities of Ottawa and St. Paul’s, bicycle lanes, library, YMCA, etc. Some events throughout the year are: glowfest, jazz fest, parades, gay pride, cycling and jogging, Winterlude, Carivibe.

Try Bridgehead Roastery’s coffee, Gelatini’s authentic gelato, Atelier’s molecular gastronomy and even Flapjacks’ quirky, Canadian theme. Choose a brew (or a few) from the famous “beer bible” at Pub Italia – a funky pub co-owned by an Italo-Irish couple, or swing by Two Six {Ate} for delicious small plates and drinks. Delizioso!

neighborhood_overview:
Elmvale Acres (2011 population: 3,280) is a neighbourhood in south Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, located in Alta Vista Ward. It was built in the late 1950s by the contractor and property developer, Robert Campeau. It is bounded on the north by Smyth Road, on the east by Othello Avenue, on the south by Pleasant Park Road and on the west by the Hydro Corridor. It includes the Elmvale Acres Shopping Centre on St. Laurent, which functions as an east end OC Transpo transit terminus. This shopping centre was the scene of a family-related shooting in September 2006.
Demographics-The neighbourhood corresponds to Census Tract 5050009.00. The neighbourhood is 63% Anglophone and 15% Francophone. Other major languages include Arabic (4%), Tagalog (2%), Portuguese (1%) and Italian (1%).

description:
Urban living in the heart of the Byward Market!

Our modern newly renovated studio was designed with luxury including granite counter tops, stainless steal appliances and more.

The studio is fully equipped for your long or short term stay. The suite features a queen size bed and sofa bed to accommodate 3 people comfortably.

Other things to note
Parking is not included. Street Parking is free on Sunday only and from 5:30pm-8:30am Monday-Saturday. There are private parking spots on George street or in the Market (both are close by Dalhousie street where we are located) the charge rate varies hourly or around $30 CAD for the full day.

*Quiet Hours
10:00 PM - 9:00 AM

*Check-in time: 4:00PM-Midnight.
*Departure: 11:00AM

*No Elevator in the building. required to climb stairs!

*Restriction No smoking inside unit Be courteous of neighbours and use best judgment for noise.

Our finished basement is carpeted with a couch, desk, lounge chair and TV.

This stay is perfect for fun weekend getaways, business trips, or temporary stays (maybe moving to Ottawa, and need somewhere to stay while you shop for homes, visiting universities, embassies, government applications)

description:
Nestled in the heart of Old Ottawa South, this sun drenched apartment is an ideal short term rental for art lovers, culture seekers, diplomats, and professionals seeking a thoughtfully curated, professionally designed home.

Steps away from the Rideau Canal (a Unesco World Heritage Site), and surrounded by hip coffee shops and tasty restaurants, you couldn't be more centrally located.

The space
The apartment itself is beautifully appointed with designer statement pieces, while the walls are adorned with the work of largely Canadian artists.

The space has a gas fireplace and a walk in shower, plus a small balcony off the kitchen, which is perfect for reading or a glass of wine in the warmer months.
neighborhood_overview: Ottawa may be known for Prime Minister Trudeau and the longest skating rink in the world (both are walking distance from my apartment!), but really what makes me love this city are the crystal blue skies, the best vegetarian food in the world (you MUST visit the Green Door Restaurant, 15 minute walk), and the exquisite Experimental Farm (a short drive or 40 minute walk from my home). The city is super clean, and my area in particular is bustling with the perfect mix of historic residential homes, sweet cafes, and great walking paths.

description:
This 100 year old building is located in the heart of Ottawa's Centretown and is just seconds from downtown, this apartment is clean, simple and couldn't be in a more perfect location. You will be one block away from Bank St. where you will find grocery stores, LCBO, coffee shops, boutiques, shopping stores and more! You'll love being seconds away from Chinatown, Little Italy, Byward Market, the Rideau Centre, Greyhound Station, Rideau canal and the Museum of Nature!

Can sleep up to 5 people.

The space
There are six apartments inside the building each with large covered balconies great for enjoying Ottawa's summer weather. The apartment is on the first floor. One of the calmer streets in the downtown core.

Guest access
Guests will have access to the entire two bedroom apartment which includes a covered balcony. There are coin operated laundry machines available in the basement for your use($1.50 for washer and $1.50 for dryer).
neighborhood_overview: Centretown is a leafy residential district with a busy commercial core of clothes stores, brunch spots and lively Irish pubs on Elgin and Bank streets. The Rideau Canal is popular for its waterside trail and becomes an ice-skating rink in winter, while Dundonald and Jack Purcell parks are dotted with monuments and public artwork. The Canadian Museum of Nature has exhibits on Arctic fossils and polar bears.

neighborhood_overview:
The Byward Market is THE tourist destination in Ottawa and is also conveniently close to Ottawa U, Parliament Hill and all downtown office buildings. The Market is full of outdoor shops and farmers markets selling local handmade goods. Rideau Centre is within walking distance for all of your shopping needs.
My house is close to two large grocery stores, multiple coffee shops and plenty of restaurants. Don't worry though, the street is very quiet at night and getting a good night's rest is easy here.

neighborhood_overview: Sandy Hill (French: Côte-de-Sable) is a neighbourhood in Ottawa, Ontario, located just east of downtown. The neighbourhood is bordered on the west by the Rideau Canal, and on the east by the Rideau River. To the north it stretches to Rideau Street and the Byward Market area while to the south it is bordered by the Queensway highway and Nicholas Street. The area is named for its hilliness, caused by the river, and its sandy soil, which makes it difficult to erect large buildings.[1] It is home to a number of embassies, residences and parks. Le cordon bleu operates its Canadian school there, at the opposite end of Sandy Hill from the University of Ottawa.

We are only 10 minutes from the Canadian Tire Centre, home to the NHL Ottawa Senators Hockey Club as well as concerts & events, Bell SENSplex and Tanger Outlets. Enjoy movies at Landmark Cinemas, Wave Pool, skiing at Mount Pakenham & Calabogie Peaks, and skating on the Rideau Canal.
Easy access to HWY 417/416, just a short 20 MIN drive to downtown.

our base rate is based on one room occupancy

The space
This is an executive townhouse end unit with easy access to highway 417 /416. We are just a short 20 mins to Ottawa downtown and conveniently located in Bridlewood Kanata South.
Other attractions located close to us include Kanata High Tech hub, Department of National Defense, Saunders Farm, Algonquin College, Canadian Golf Club, Loch March Golf Club, Diefenbunker Museum, Bayshore Shopping Mall, Wesley Clover Park, and the Trans Canada Trail Sy
neighborhood_overview:
Excellent and conveniently located in Bridlewood Kanata South.

Steps away from bus stops
Minutes away from High way 417
Minutes away from Restaurents, gas station, Tim hortons and Star bucks
Minutes away from Trans Canada Trails for hiking, biking.

Shopping
With such close proximity to both Kanata, Bayshore and Bells Corners and their large shopping clusters, this community is quiet.

Recreation
The community has lots of parks and forested areas, and has the Trans-Canada Trail, connecting into downtown Ottawa, and east & west to other parts of Canada. Nearby in Glen Cairn Park is an indoor pool, racquet courts, and public library, and there is a running track beside AY Jackson High School. The east edge of the neighbourhood adjoins the Stony Swamp Conservation Area which extends east all the way to Bells Corners.

neighborhood_overview:
My Apartment is located in the Downtown Glebe, a local, hip and nostalgic neighbourhood bustling with local businesses and an irresistible trendy vibe.

It is on a quiet residential street yet very close to everything, including parliament/byward market. Great restaurants, bars, coffee shops, museums - all nearby.

Steps to Lansdowne Park/TD Place Stadium if your coming to watch your favorite sports team. Lansdowne Park features everything from relaxation to recreation. Landsdowne Park is a must see destination for tourists, a hub to connect neighbourhoods, a quite oasis, a destination for shopping, restaurants and entertainment. neighborhood_overview: Centretown is a leafy residential district with a busy commercial core of clothes stores, brunch spots and lively Irish pubs on Elgin and Bank streets. The Rideau Canal is popular for its waterside trail and becomes an ice-skating rink in winter, while Dundonald and Jack Purcell parks are dotted with monuments and public artwork. The Canadian Museum of Nature has exhibits on Arctic fossils and polar bears.

description:
Take in Panoramic City Views from the roof top of a Sophisticated Heritage Condominium .
Welcome to Ottawa where unforgettable stays are elevated to a fine art. Enjoy the exceptional service and world-class comforts perfectly positioned amidst some of the finest attractions, services and conveniences our nation’s capital has to offer. The condo features floor-to-ceiling windows,
Steps away from the bayward market , Rideue centre and the Parliament. Historically Ottawa is welcoming and friendly

The space
Enjoy BBQ on your private Patio or join Canada Day Parade .Completely re decorated by world renown interior designer in March 2019 with all brand new furniture and 2 Giant Tv’s. Centrally located moments from the Rideau Centre, Shaw Centre and the ByWard Market, with a Walk Score of 98, a Transit Score of 93 and Bike Score of 95, This condo is the place to be. Private Terrance , Side door to private Balcony. Free onsite parking , Bright , stylish and
neighborhood_overview:
On the edge of the ByWard Market, The Shaw Centre , Rideue Centre , Parliment Hill, University of Ottawa and all the attractions, The Condo benefits from an ideal LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION

The extravagant redevelopment of Rideau Centre, along with ByWard Market’s unique array of specialty shops and fashion boutiques makes for a world class shopping experience.

Furthermore, a few steps away from your lobby, is the center of the city’s thriving creative scene, with exhibitions from the top local and world-renowned artists showcased right in your neighbourhood.

Quaint cafes and patisseries give ByWard Market an old time charm, while the city’s top-rated fine dining establishments and chic cocktail lounges provide the luxe contemporary feel of urban life. Endless culinary variety is yours as every type of cuisine offers up a new cultural experience.

A perfect place to call your "Home Away from Home" in Ottawa,  located right next to the Highway which takes you anywhere in Ottawa City in minutes. 20 Min ✈/ DOWNTOWN🌷🚴🍫🐣

Great for family getaway or events at Bells Sensplex, Canadian tire Centre, Winter Brewfest, Tanger outlet 🛍️☕

Some bedrooms might be locked depends on the reservation. Please see "Guest Access" section for details. sofa bed is provided when reservation is for 9 guests or more

base rate is for 2 rooms


$$Value 💰 ++

The space
This is an executive townhouse end unit within 20 mins from downtown. Excellent and conveniently located in Bridlewood Kanata South close to 417, close to Tanger Outlets, Canadian Tire Center perfect for Senators games and concerts. Very close and convenient to Bell Sensplex, for families with events being hosted there. Close to Kanata North Tech Park and DND Carling campus. Enjoy a stress free self check in, no need to me
neighborhood_overview:
Steps away from bus stops
Minutes away from High way 417
Minutes away from Restaurents, gas station, Tim hortons and Star bucks
Minutes away from Trans Canada Trails for hiking, biking, walk

Shopping
With such close proximity to both Kanata and Bells Corners and their large shopping clusters, this community is quiet.

Recreation
The community has lots of parks and forested areas, and has the Trans-Canada Trail, connecting into downtown Ottawa, and east & west to other parts of Canada. Nearby in Glen Cairn Park is an indoor pool, racquet courts, and public library, and there is a running track beside AY Jackson High School. The east edge of the neighbourhood adjoins the Stony Swamp Conservation Area which extends east all the way to Bells Corners.

With abundant natural light, and crisp, tasteful decor, it's a welcoming and convenient place to return to after a long day of work or fun.

The space
This adorable bachelor is attached to the main house. It comes with a queen size bed, and a sofa bed. Linens, towels, shampoo, conditioner and body wash are all included.

The kitchenette has a small fridge, portable cooktop, toaster, microwave and dishes required to cook a good meal.

High-speed wifi and Netflix are also included. There is also a brand new washer and dryer in the unit for guest use. Everything you need for a comfortable and enjoyable short term stay!

description:
Welcome to Michel Circle, a Beechwood Village Retreat!
The moment you come in you will feel home. Seeking a relaxing experience with all the life and culture the city has to offer? Welcome to the best of Michel Circle!
It is just minutes from downtown Ottawa, shopping, groceries, local swimming hole, restaurants, hiking trails, bike paths, and much more. It's your perfect getaway in the heart of the city where you will be able to de-stress in front of the fireplace after a busy day.

The space
A short drive or bus ride from the Byward Market and downtown, this is the perfect place for your stay in Ottawa. You will have an amazing, fully equipped, open kitchen, a large living room with TV and a wood fireplace, 3 bedrooms (1 queen bed and 2 double beds), a private washroom, WIFI+ parking for up to two vehicles.
neighborhood_overview:
We are just minutes walk or drive from:
- Shopping, groceries, cafés, pubs, and restaurants on Beechwood;
- Downtown Ottawa including Parliament Hill, National Art Gallery, Rideau Centre shopping mall, the Byward Market, the ByTowne Cinema, Rideau Canal, and the University of Ottawa;
- Natural treasures including historic Rockcliffe Park, a local swimming hole, fishing, NCC bike paths, and the Gatineau Hills.

Did you know? We have over 800 kilometers of bike paths in Ottawa! Check out the VeloGO bicycle rentals at the corner of Beechwood and Vanier Parkway and start your journey.

description:

The space
The main bedroom in the home with a queen bed, closet and armoire. The room is located on the main level of the house and the host stays in the basement.

There is a full kitchen, dining room and living space to enjoy. The bathroom has a soaker tub and towels are provided.

Our cat Korra lives with us and is very friendly. Please top up her food or water in the bathroom when empty. There is a crib available if you have a baby or toddler.

Self check-in with a keyless entry

As Stittsville is located just a stone’s throw from bustling communities in neighbouring areas of Kanata and Ottawa’s downtown core, Stittsville residents have a world of fantastic local resources and amenities right at their fingertips. Ranging from great opportunities for shopping and recreation to all kinds of churches, local schools and top-quality public transit services, Stittsville is today a vibrant and charming town with much to offer its residents and visitors alike.

Within Stittsville’s borders you’ll find all kinds of local health resources in the way of various medical clinics, pharmacies and dentists; and a wealth of recreational opportunities throughout Stittsville’s Goulbourn Recreation Complex, baseball diamonds, sports fields, arenas, local youth centre, public parks and trails and so much more. Residents can also take advantage of the area’s great shopping along Stittsville Main Street, Hazeldean Road with the Grant Crossing Shopping Center. Tanger Outlets

description:
Situated in a quiet yet centrally located street, this newly renovated 2-bedroom suite is just steps from the canal, restaurants, cafés, bus routes, and all the attractions that Canada's capital city has to offer. Park your car in our private driveway and cycle or walk (or skate in winter!) along bucolic riverside paths into the heart of the city. In summer, enjoy your morning organic coffee listening to the birds on the backyard terrace. In winter, cozy up in front of your own gas fireplace.

The space
Enter the apartment through your private entrance at the rear of the house. The entrance is spacious, with room for extra luggage or even a bike or two.

The kitchen is fully-equipped, with a full-size fridge/freezer, microwave, oven, toaster, electric kettle, and all the equipment you need to make a gourmet meal.

Most importantly, we know how important good coffee and tea is to most guests, so we have provided good organic, fairtrade coffee a
neighborhood_overview:
Want to enjoy a great coffee, eat in one of the best vegetarian restaurants in Ottawa, or hit a farmer's market on a Saturday morning? No problem - they are all just a 5 minute walk away.

Walk just a few hundred metres south on Main Street to Sula Wok for delicious Asian street food or Little Italy Fine Foods for amazing espresso and Italian fare. The Green Door restaurant, an Ottawa icon, is just a few steps further for a delicious vegetarian meal. On Saturday's from 9am-3pm in summer there is also a farmer's market in the parking lot next to the restaurant. We can also recommend a number of great, reasonably priced Vietnamese restaurants just a little further afield (25-30 min walk).

Other cafes and restaurants, a large grocery store (Loblaw's), and a liquor store are just a 5-10 min walk away. There is also a great Korean grocery (Seoul Mart) right behind Loblaw's if you love Asian food like us!

description:
Ottawa was tijdens de Tweede Wereldoorlog de woonplaats van prinses Juliana en haar kinderen, waardoor de stad nog steeds een speciale band met Nederland heeft. Elk jaar, in de maand mei, vindt in Ottawa het Tulip Festival plaats waarbij het Nederlandse koningshuis tulpenbollen naar de stad stuurt als dankgebaar voor de huisvesting van leden van de koninklijke familie alsmede de Canadese hulp tijdens de bevrijding van Nederland.

The space
Ottawa werd op 31 december 1857 gekozen als de hoofdstad van Canada: de keuze voor de stad was een compromis, omdat andere kandidaten zoals Montreal en Toronto te uitgesproken een Franse of Engelse traditie uitstraalden. Bovendien lag de stad verder van de grens met de Verenigde Staten, wat als een (militair) voordeel werd beschouwd.

description:
Welcome to Five Sprites, the BnB at 118 Queen Elizabeth Dr, Ottawa. The house guests out 5 rooms, 4 on the 2nd floor share the same bathroom; room 5 on the 3rd floor has its own bathroom and balcony. Continental breakfast (juice, coffee, tea, milk, cereal, yoghurt, toast, bread, jam, peanut butter, muffins occasionally, etc) - is available 7-12noon. My friend, Phil, (and his miniature poodle, Junior) live in the basement and occasionally use the ground floor.

The space
We are located in downtown Ottawa, right on the Rideau Canal, close to many locations of interest: the canal, banks, groceries, pharmacies, museums, restaurants, bars, cafes, theaters, embassies, gyms, Chinatown, Little Italy, Universities of Ottawa and St. Paul’s, bicycle lanes, library, YMCA, etc. Some events throughout the year are: glowfest, jazz fest, parades, gay pride, cycling and jogging, Winterlude, Carivibe.

Guest access
You will be able to access and use the ground
neighborhood_overview: Lots of people walking themselves and/or dogs, joggers, cyclists, skaters (in Winter). Within walking distance is Elgin Street with its shops and eateries, the Museum of Nature, YMCA, Ottawa U, Main Street, and, of course, the canal, with its activities in the Summer and skating in the Winter.

description:
Welcome to our QUIET and UNCLUTTERED family home. Where you can relax in between visiting all that Canada's capital and our wonderful neighborhood have to offer! We list our place when we are away, therefore nearly the entire home is available to you and we are readily available by phone/email/text. With 4 bedrooms upstairs and a family room with pull out couch on the lower level, many options for sleeping arrangements exist. We welcome families and responsible adults, no loud parties thanks!

The space
Our home is a lovely updated 1960s semi-detached 4 bedroom home with 1 off-street parking space included. There are 2 bathrooms upstairs (ensuite with shower, and main with bath + shower), and a half-bath on the main level. Kitchen is stocked with pots/pans, dishes, utensils, stove/oven, microwave, blender, toaster and fridge/freezer. Washer and dryer are on the main level and available to guests. The home is child and baby-friendly and many baby items are availab
neighborhood_overview: Westboro Beach neighborhood is centrally located in Ottawa with brilliantly easy transit and bike access to the city centre. Westboro is also a destination in its own right and is known for shops, restaurants, coffee shops, yoga studios (Pure Yoga) and outdoor gear stores (MEC). Our home is a 10 minute walk to the main road with all of these amenities. Grocery stores (Farm Boy and Superstore) are also a quick 10-15min walk away. Don't forget the beach!! Less than a 10min walk from our home, the beach is popular for lounging and swimming and has a cafe with daily live music in the evening all summer!

description:
Stay in the best neighbourhood in Ottawa. Glebe / Old Ottawa South. Only a 5 minute walk from the Rideau Canal. 10 minute walk to Landsdowne Park (home of the Redblacks, 67s, and Fury). Walk to some of the best restaurants, bars, and sites that Ottawa has to offer!

My home is an old century home in this historic neighbourhood that I've newly renovated with modern finishings from top to bottom. Tonnes of space for your family and friends to relax and feel at home.

The space
My home is fully automated. Meaning lights, door, temperature control can all be controlled via phone apps or Alexa (yes you can ask Alexa to turn off the kitchen lights).

Access to my home is granted through phone app or lockbox at the front door. I prefer going through the app, but let me know if this is not convenient for you.

Audio speakers in the main kitchen and living area to play your favorite songs.

Full washer and dryer is available
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is beautiful and historic.  Close to almost everything that Ottawa has to offer.  A 5 minute walk gets you right onto the canal, where you can walk along it all the way to the Parliament buildings and Byward Market.  You can also walk to Landsdowne Park (home of the RedBlacks) and many bars and restaurants.  There is a coffee shop (Happy Goat) right down the street and a Bridgehead coffee (I promise it's better than Starbucks).  There are also numerous restaurants and beautiful book stores, movie theatres down historic Bank St.  Wholefoods, Shoppers Drug Mart, and other stores are all within walking distance of the property.

Simply furnished with the essentials.

PARKING:
Street parking is free/unlimited on weekends on adjacent streets. Everywhere in Ottawa has a 6hour limit during the day (unless otherwise indicated). description:
This is a cozy and bright bachelor apartment in our basement; entrance is shared. The living area includes a sofa bed that accommodates a couple and there is a single bed in a separate area. The kitchenette is equipped with microwave oven, cook top and a mini fridge along with basic utensils. If you need parking we can provide space in our driveway. The area is full of green spaces and bike paths and the house is a 20 min walk to the Greenboro bus/train station. We can only host two guests.

Guest access
Guests have access to our laundry provided they are staying for longer than 5 days. There is free parking space in our driveway.

Other things to note
The reservation is exclusive for the person whose profile was used to book through AirBnb, we do not accept third parties who do not have a profile on AirBnb. Also, if you have an extra guest, the reservation is exclusive for that guest - we do not accept exchanges of guests during your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Greenboro, as the name suggests, is full of nature. There are bike paths and parks, several sports venues (tennis, baseball and basketball courts) outdoors and public swimming pools. If you like biking this is a great way to see the city.

We are a 20min walk to the Greenboro train and bus station, through which you can get pretty much anywhere in the city.

The station is located in a mall area where you can find groceries, clothes, bookstores, restaurants and a Starbucks.

description:
Stunning elegant 3 bedroom home, backing up into a park. Perfect for a family reunion, couple retreat, business trip, friends getaway. The house is centrally located in Westboro and walking distance to everything this trendy neighbourhood has to offer. Only 5 km to downtown.


You will love the high ceilings, the fully equipped kitchen, the comfortable bedrooms and nice family room, the private backyard with its eating area, lounge and propane fire pit.

Your kids will also love it here!

The space
Our 2 storey custom home was built back in 2008 and has a unique feel to it. The well appointed kitchen is at the center of the house, with a big island accommodating seating for four. On the main floor, you will also find a dining room, formal bright living room, powder room and very cozy family room with a smart TV and gas fireplace.

The main floor has high ceilings ranging between 11 to 12 feet high. There are 4 bathrooms
neighborhood_overview:
Westboro is a well established trendy neighbourhood, with tons of coffee places, fantastic restaurants to choose from and shops to explore. Our house is located on a quiet street only 2 blocks from Richmond Road, where you will find all the action. The neighbourhood is busy enough to keep you entertained and yet, quiet enough that you forget that you are in the city! There are several parks in the area, a local farmers market close by and easy access to cycling trails.

You can reach the Superstore, Liquor store, Farm Boys etc. in less then 7 minute walk. Westboro Station is 800 metres away and Westboro Beach 1.3 km away.

The greatest part is that you can do everything and reach any of the Capital main attractions by foot, bicycle, or public transport.


In the summer, the city maintain a nice waddle pool in the park behind our house to keep cool and have fun in the water. There are even lifeguards and students to help look after your little ones

neighborhood_overview:
There is a neighbourhood mall near by - 10 minute walk or 2 minute drive - with a grocery store, drug store, beer and liquor store, bank, hardware store, Starbucks, and several eat-in or take-out restaurants.
The Ottawa Health Science Center is also near by - again 10 minute walk or 2 minute drive. The center is comprised of the General Campus of the Ottawa Hospital, Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario, Royal Ottawa Rehabilitation Center, Children's Treatment Center, plus several other medical specialty facilities.

If you have children, there is a park, public wading and swimming pools nearby.

The space
Nestled in a wonderful and diverse neighbourhood, guests will enjoy exploring.

Guest access
Guests may utilize a dedicated parking spot in the driveway.
Laundry is available onsite.

description:
This bright and beautiful newly renovated heritage home is over 200 years old! Step back in time with original exposed stone walls and framing built from trees which were alive in the 1700s. Modern elements combined with rustic features are sure to make your stay memorable and unique! Luxurious linens, Endy mattresses and plenty of pillows guarantee the best night ever.

Note the exterior is monitored by a security camera. Parking would not fit a truck due to length, as the alley is too narrow.

Complimentary tea and coffee (using our Keurig with optional milk frother!) ensure you get your mornings started right. Walk to the National Art Gallery only a half a block away, or the Byward Market is sure to please with its countless restaurants, buskers and shops, only a 2 minute walk from your front door! In the summer, sit out on your private back deck and BBQ up some burgers for you and your friends, and enjoy the city life in a tiny oasis just for you.

Eve

With a separate entrance to the suite, you can come and go as you please without worry.
Shopping, theatres and downtown Ottawa are a short bus ride (20 minutes) or car drive (10 minutes) away.

neighborhood_overview:
There is a neighbourhood mall near by - 10 minute walk or 2 minute drive - with a grocery store, drug store, beer and liquor store, bank, hardware store, Starbucks, and several eat-in or take-out restaurants.
The Ottawa Health Science Center is also near by - again 10 minute walk or 2 minute drive. The center is comprised of the General Campus of the Ottawa Hospital, Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario, Royal Ottawa Rehabilitation Center, Children's Treatment Center, plus several other medical specialty facilities.
