description:
Brand new build, newly furnished, located in the heart of Sandyhill. Ideal for couples or single travellers. Less than a 10 min walk to Byward Market, Ottawa University, Grocery stores, Rideau Center, LCBO, Beer store, Nightlife, Restaurants, banks, pharmacies, Yoga studios, Coffee shops & more. Walk to museums, National Arts Center, National Gallery & Parliament hill. Easy self check in. Great location & space! Long Term rentals are welcome. Photos will be updated soon.

The space
This is a basement apartment located in a brand new building. The unit includes top of the line finishings, hard wood floors, granite counter tops and stainless steel appliances.

Guest access
The entire apartment is yours - this is not a shared space.
neighborhood_overview:
Sandy Hill -
Sandy Hill is a neighbourhood in Ottawa, located just east of downtown. The neighbourhood is bordered on the west by the Rideau Canal and on the east by the Rideau River. To the north it stretches to Rideau Street and the Byward Market area while to the south it is bordered by the Queensway highway and Nicholas Street. It is home to a number of embassies, residences and parks. Le cordon bleu operates its Canadian school there, at the opposite end of Sandy Hill from the University of Ottawa.

Byward Market -
Join some friends for brunch, lunch or dinner, and then hit the shops for the highest quality food products, fashions and cutting edge trends. See and be seen until the wee hours at one of our hip nightspots. Morning, noon and night the ByWard Market has something just for you. Established by Lt-Col. John By in 1826, the ByWard Market is one of Canada's oldest and largest public markets. The legendary builder of the Rideau Canal, Colonel By himself

10:00 PM - 9:00 AM

description:
We are conveniently located in Centretown/downtown, 5 mins walk to bank street, 10 mins walk to downtown government offices and 20 mins walk to Parliament.

What to expect: you are sharing the house with a couple, tidy and clean. The entire basement unit is yours. It is quite spacious but you are welcome to spend as much time in common areas as you wish. The bathroom, living room and kitchen is shared.
Paid parking is nearby. Street parking is free from 4pm until about 10am.

The space
This unit is quite spacious and has both east and west facing windows. Beautiful, exposed brick wall. There is a TV with a DVD player for movies and is available Netflix upstairs. Ample closet space with a dresser. Basement has a queen sized bed with a futon.

Other things to note
Note: This townhouse is not air conditioned. The basement is quite cool during the summer. Additionally, the basement has a small portion of roof that is 5'9"
neighborhood_overview:
This townhouse is on a quiet, residential one-way street, so noise should not be an issue.

On foot, Bank St is five minutes away. It has many great patios, a grocery store, ice cream shops, and everything else you'd need.

Downtown government building are a 10 minute walk away in case you have any meetings or business to conduct.

Parliament is also very nearby, along with the Rideau Locks, Museum of Nature, and other attractions.

description:
COMFORTABLE ACCOMMODATION TO SUIT YOUR NEEDS
Whether you are in town for a few nights or a few weeks, Henia's Inn knows how to accommodate your needs. Our guest are treated with HOME MADE BREAKFAST which are served every morning.
Located close to Senators Stadium (Canadian Tire C.), Tanger outlet and many other facilities. Spacious ~1.9 sqf. Public Transit.
My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and families with kids.
Free street parking, free unlimited WiFi.

The space
Brand new on Airbnb!!!
This room #3 can accommodate up to 2 gusts (1 bed). If you need more accommodations, please reserve rooms #1 and #2.

Other things to note
There is still constriction going on around the location.
neighborhood_overview:
As Stittsville is located just a stone’s throw from bustling communities in neighbouring areas of Kanata and Ottawa’s downtown core, Stittsville residents have a world of fantastic local resources and amenities right at their fingertips. Ranging from great opportunities for shopping and recreation to all kinds of churches, local schools and top-quality public transit services, Stittsville is today a vibrant and charming town with much to offer its residents and visitors alike.

Within Stittsville’s borders you’ll find all kinds of local health resources in the way of various medical clinics, pharmacies and dentists; and a wealth of recreational opportunities throughout Stittsville’s Goulbourn Recreation Complex, baseball diamonds, sports fields, arenas, local youth centre, public parks and trails and so much more. Residents can also take advantage of the area’s great shopping along Stittsville Main Street, Hazeldean Road with the Grant Crossing Shopping Center. Tanger Outlets

description:
Delightful country retreat located on 140 acres, with groomed trails for cross-country skiing, snow shoeing or just a stroll in nature. There is also a rustic cabin located on the property with a large bonfire pit complete with seating and plenty of sticks for roasting marshmallows. For a fee, we are happy to prepare A hot chilli to warm you and your guests. Previous events held on the property have included weddings, rehearsal dinners and wedding photo shoots.

The space
A 2 night minimum stay is required. No pets, parties or smoking allowed.
neighborhood_overview: We are 35 minutes from downtown Ottawa and 10 minutes from Barrhaven, an Ottawa suburb with everything you’ll need in the way of grocery stores, restaurants, LCBO, etc,. For a pleasant  day’s outing , we are 10 minutes from the charming town of Manotick, a popular  tourist destination full of history and  great restaurants. There is also a historic  place 30 minutes from us, Merrickville  which is a quaint town with lots of unique shops. There are plenty of golf courses nearby and we are 10 minutes from Hurst marina, if you are boater.

description:
Cozy apartment in the heart of Hintonburg! This large 1-Bedroom plus office is steps from parks, nightlife and countless shops. Walk to the Parkdale Market, Chinatown, Little Italy or the Ottawa river.

Dine in or eat out steps from home (pending City of Ottawa COVID guidelines). There are dozens of quality restaurants, bars, coffee shops, bakeries, boutiques, farmers market, Westboro beach with a bar playing live Latin music, Experimental farm with botanical gardens, walks, boat rentals.

The space
This apartment is on the first floor of a beautiful historic duplex located at the heart of the Hintonburg. Parking in the rear of the building. Updated with a lot of love, this hideaway features modern floors with rustic touches, full kitchen and 3 private patios. The duplex sleeps 2 adults comfortably, with 1 king size bed. If you are inviting others, there is ample room for a blowup mattress in the office (bring your own).

neighborhood_overview:
Sandy Hill -
Sandy Hill is a neighbourhood in Ottawa, located just east of downtown. The neighbourhood is bordered on the west by the Rideau Canal and on the east by the Rideau River. To the north it stretches to Rideau Street and the Byward Market area while to the south it is bordered by the Queensway highway and Nicholas Street. It is home to a number of embassies, residences and parks. Le cordon bleu operates its Canadian school there, at the opposite end of Sandy Hill from the University of Ottawa.

Byward Market -
Join some friends for brunch, lunch or dinner, and then hit the shops for the highest quality food products, fashions and cutting edge trends. See and be seen until the wee hours at one of our hip nightspots. Morning, noon and night the ByWard Market has something just for you. Established by Lt-Col. John By in 1826, the ByWard Market is one of Canada's oldest and largest public markets. The legendary builder of the Rideau Canal, Colonel By himself

neighborhood_overview:
As Stittsville is located just a stone’s throw from bustling communities in neighbouring areas of Kanata and Ottawa’s downtown core, Stittsville residents have a world of fantastic local resources and amenities right at their fingertips. Ranging from great opportunities for shopping and recreation to all kinds of churches, local schools and top-quality public transit services, Stittsville is today a vibrant and charming town with much to offer its residents and visitors alike.

Within Stittsville’s borders you’ll find all kinds of local health resources in the way of various medical clinics, pharmacies and dentists; and a wealth of recreational opportunities throughout Stittsville’s Goulbourn Recreation Complex, baseball diamonds, sports fields, arenas, local youth centre, public parks and trails and so much more. Residents can also take advantage of the area’s great shopping along Stittsville Main Street, Hazeldean Road with the Grant Crossing Shopping Center. Tanger Outlets

description:
Your personal pied-à-terre in downtown Ottawa. This historic Victorian rowhouse will conjure images of a New York brownstone, or a London townhouse. Located on a quiet residential street in a beautiful heritage area of one of Ottawa's best urban neighbourhoods, Sandy Hill. Walking distance to most of Ottawa's attractions, including the ByWard Market, University of Ottawa, Ottawa Convention Centre, Rideau Centre, National Gallery, National Arts Centre, and Parliament.

The space
Spacious, renovated, main floor apartment in historic Victorian rowhouse. Best of modern amenities with lots of period charm.

Guest access
The whole main floor apartment is yours.
neighborhood_overview: Sandy Hill is one of Ottawa's premier urban neighbourhoods, bounded by the Rideau Canal, Rideau Street and the Rideau River. It's leafy streets are lined with heritage homes, many of which house ambassadors and other foreign diplomats. Sandy Hill is home to the University of Ottawa, Le Cordon Bleu, the Ottawa Art Gallery, Ottawa Little Theatre, and the Rideau Centre. The best of Ottawa is all within walking distance.

neighborhood_overview:
Located in the Civic Hospital area and directly in front of the expanse of the historic experimental farm, you’ll wake to bright beautiful sunrises through the large living room window and enjoy the western sun on the rooftop deck or in the kitchen through the wall to wall patio door. The farm is a great location to walk or ride bikes and serves as the most beautiful scenic route to downtown as you pass Dow’s lake and the Rideau canal.

This is an ideal location since it allows one to have excellent access to Centretown just 7 minutes away but also allows you to enjoy other arguably better parts of the city which reflect more on its character and offerings.

Hintonburg is a hip little neighbourhood with great social spots and is located just minutes away. East of Hintonburg is Little Italy. Both have excellent restaurants, cafes and bars.
The home also has great access to the Glebe neighbourhood, Bank street, and Landsdowne Park via the ‘Driveway’ along the

neighborhood_overview:
PLACES TO VISIT

Parliament Hill
​
Parliament Hill is an area of Crown land on the southern banks of the Ottawa River in downtown Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. Its Gothic revival suite of buildings is the home of the Parliament of Canada and has architectural elements of national symbolic importance.

Little Italy

Little Italy is the cultural centre of Ottawa's Italian community that features 42 restaurants with cuisines from around the world! There’s more than just great food and shopping here - Little Italy hosts many interesting things to do! From virtual reality games to comedy, live theatre, murder mystery, live music and even magic, there are many great options to entertain families, adults and kids of all ages.

Museums

Home to seven of Canada’s nine national museums, Ottawa is the mecca for culture vultures, historical enthusiasts and Canadiana buffs. Add these national museums to your Ottawa itinerary:
​
- Na

description:
独立大house 的一部分，但是完全独立使用, 私密性最好。也可以使用大厨房做饭，进入后院纳凉放松。 客厅内有基础健身器材。 60寸大彩电链接互联网使用，可以搜看全世界的节目。交通便利，2分钟即到公交站，86 、186、111可去市区及附近各大院校。门前停车位免费使用，冬季可以停室内停车位。 华人房东友善热情，可以协商价格提供接送机，及导游旅游，包括包餐服务。 北方面食，川菜，粉汤等。亦可提供食材，客人自行加工。 开车自驾到大部分区域都只需要十几分钟车程，周边购物便利，附近cosco 超市，Walmart 超市等，坐车，走路，开车，都极其方便。

The space
大卧室三面有窗，宽敞明亮，全部使用五星级酒店式的纯白色床上用品，提供全套卫衣设施，及一次性牙刷等。 客厅宽敞舒适静谧，适合看电视放松。 卫生间明亮干净，洗衣机烘干机电视，烫衣机，全新且功能完善。

Guest access
后院，及后院的休闲区，包括野餐桌椅等，前院停车位，大厨房，及厨房用具。自己一室一厅房间内的所有用品。

Other things to note

There are 2 free parking spaces on premise.

description:

Room one (1) has a double bed, sofa, tables and lamps, a desk and an office chair. Appropriate for working at home individuals.

Room # 2 is also furnished with a queen bed, dressers, two armchairs, tables and lamps.

Two people can book & occupy one room at a time according to their needs.

The space
This is a very quiet home with a senior tenant living in the basement apartment, completely independent from the rest of the house. However, build in the late '50s, walking noise from above is very clear during silent hours, and going up and downstairs. I recommend that people walk softly to minimize the echo. The historic Rideau Canal with great sites is also within walking distance.  Really a great location loves it and would not move to anywhere else.

neighborhood_overview:
Sandy Hill -
Sandy Hill is a neighbourhood in Ottawa, located just east of downtown. The neighbourhood is bordered on the west by the Rideau Canal and on the east by the Rideau River. To the north it stretches to Rideau Street and the Byward Market area while to the south it is bordered by the Queensway highway and Nicholas Street. It is home to a number of embassies, residences and parks. Le cordon bleu operates its Canadian school there, at the opposite end of Sandy Hill from the University of Ottawa.

Byward Market -
Join some friends for brunch, lunch or dinner, and then hit the shops for the highest quality food products, fashions and cutting edge trends. See and be seen until the wee hours at one of our hip nightspots. Morning, noon and night the ByWard Market has something just for you. Established by Lt-Col. John By in 1826, the ByWard Market is one of Canada's oldest and largest public markets. The legendary builder of the Rideau Canal, Colonel By himself

neighborhood_overview:
Shop one-of-a-kind boutiques on Westboro streets. (5 min. drive)

Visit Westboro beach that has live music, a lifeguard on site and dancing under the stars. (10 min. drive)

Order delicious inexpensive Chinese food at the Cypres Garden take out. (10 min. drive)

Go to Landsdowne Park for great restaurants and visit the Farmer’s Market on Sundays. (12 min.)

Bike or l, in the winter, skate the Rideau Canal. (12 min. drive)

Participate in Ottawa’s fantastic annual Bluesfest every July. Check for exact dates online.

Visit one of Ottawa’s museums. Many have free admission one night a week.

Go riverboarding on the Ottawa River.

You can also visit Little Italy and Chinatown for great restaurant choices. (10 min. drive)

description:
Seven Directions Lodge is a perfect glamping experience. It sits in the middle of Davalon Healing Centre; a longtime hub of activity for many Indigenous ceremonies. Spend some time absorbing the sacred horse medicine or snuggle with an alpaca. Participate in farm chores, workshops, & walk the 6.5 miles of trails. **Book a chakra clearing, cultural healings & aroma touch massages ** (suspended)- all offered onsite including our beautiful "Healing with Horses" sessions.

The space
The hand hewn log home built in 1850, gracing the 100 acre property, has been lovingly restored in recent years. Following it's purchase in 1998, the entire parcel of land has been clear of herbicides and pesticides and has become a birders paradise with a huge variety of winged ones. Often, in early morning, deer can be observed grazing within a few feet of the cabin. Camping is available adjacent to the cabin for renters use.
Only 40 km from Ottawa, Seven Directions Lodge i
neighborhood_overview: Seven Directions Lodge rests within a five minute drive from the bustling town of Richmond, Ontario with it's half dozen restaurants, thriving grocery store and all other amenities. We are in the heart of the Ottawa valley with a short trip to downtown Ottawa.  Visit Historic towns of Manotick, Merrickville and beautiful Perth.

neighborhood_overview: Ottawa’s Centretown is home to some of the finest outdoor amenities found not only in the city, but in the entire nation. It is a year-round escape from the ordinary, a playground of vibrant activities in your own backyard.Skating on the Rideau Canal is the epitome of the Canadian lifestyle – chic, active and beautiful. Six months later, it’s the perfect locale for a quick morning jog before heading out to work, past manicured trails and parklands. If a year-round, active outdoor lifestyle is what you are looking for, Centretown has it.

description:

Lovely Fully Furn.'d Bedrm within a 3 bedroom stunningly renovated Apt in Brick Triplex /5 min walk to Ottawa U., 10 min. walk to Downtown, 5 min. to Cordon Bleu Culin. School
Safe, Modern, Charming, lovely backyard, No Partying

The space
These are shared fully furnished 3 bedroom apartments, well maintained and cared for. They offer a peaceful retreat and accommodate an existing base of Ottawa Univ. mature students and professors or tenants with contractual summer jobs with the government. The space
This is the basement apartment of a 3 unit home. The space includes a private entrance with living space, kitchen, and bathroom. The front and backyard belongs to the people living upstairs, so you won't be able to use them, however there is a big park just down the road. There is parking for this apartment for two vehicles on the driveway, and there is more street parking.

Note: Wifi is included in the price with a value of roughly 5$/day. If you don't need WIFI, let me know and we will re
neighborhood_overview: There are many parks in this beautiful neighbourhood, including a park just down the street. The place is walking distance to a mini mall which includes a convenience store and a few restaurants. Merivale road is a 5-10 minutes drive with larger stores (including Costco, Walmart, Loblaws, Farmboy, Independent, Metro, and Freshco) diverse restaurants, and more. Bank street is 15 minutes drive, and you can reach most popular places in and around Ottawa in under a half hour!

As the home owner, we live next door and are very knowledgeable about Ottawa and will happily provide helpful tips.

Our space is a three floor apartment with two bedrooms on the second floor and two bedrooms in the basement. At the front of the building is our restaurant.

Guest access
Guests will have access to the room or rooms they are renting along with the main floor which includes the open concept living, dining room and kitchen. Please understand that bedrooms that are not being rented will be locked and not be accessible for guests.

The Rideau canal is a stones throw away for winter skating or summer jogging.

neighborhood_overview:
My Apartment is located in the Downtown Glebe, a local, hip and nostalgic neighbourhood bustling with local businesses and an irresistible trendy vibe.

It is on a quiet residential street yet very close to everything, including parliament/byward market. Great restaurants, bars, coffee shops, museums - all nearby.

Steps to Lansdowne Park/TD Place Stadium if your coming to watch your favorite sports team. Lansdowne Park features everything from relaxation to recreation. Landsdowne Park is a must see destination for tourists, a hub to connect neighbourhoods, a quite oasis, a destination for shopping, restaurants and entertainment. It has something to offer for everyone to enjoy.

Steps to the Canal - beautiful trail for a morning run and a refreshing bike ride. Make sure to check out the Byward Market and Parliament in downtown core, minutes away!

description:
Come back to the joys of childhood and the simple life in this one of a kind custom designed off-grid tree house hidden in a private area surrounded by water and 100 acres of deep forest! Enjoy the sounds and views of bullfrogs, songbirds, turtles, squirrels, and wolves as you dose off into nature's sanctuary.

The space
The inside is made of rustic pine and white oak boards with over 330 square feet of custom wood work. There is also a wood stove inside the tree house for a 4 season experience!

The tree house is 9 feet off the ground and a perfect arena to unplug and spend some time living simply with nature sounds, smells and animals. We provide board games, a quiet setting with a beautiful view and sounds of the pond. You are welcome to use the canoe provided.

Guest access
You can access all indoor and outdoor areas around the treehouse.

Winter - access 100 acres of forest with cross country skis and/or snowshoes!
neighborhood_overview:
The area is close to quaint towns to explore like Almonte and Carp. Surroundings are mostly farmland and homes. Carp Farmer's market is a popular destination Saturday mornings in the summer time and Cheshire Cat Pub is the closest local pub with great food that's always packed all season long. Closest grocery store is in Sobeys in Stittsville or Independent in Almonte. Equator Coffee shop and Dandelion foods are my favourite places to go in Almonte for natural foods and coffee/snacks.

Here are my top picks of the area:

1.) Cheshire Cat Pub (very good pub food)

 2.) Blakeney Rapids Lanark (beautiful spot for trails beside the town of Almonte)

3.) Pakenham Falls (very close to Almonte and well worth checking out to sit under the waterfalls, good spots for fishing also)

3.) Carp Creamery (for home made ice cream)

4.) Stan's Putt Putt Land (nice space for some mini-golf)

description:
Lovely home located near the Center of Manotick. The home is an 8-minute walk to the quaint town of Manotick. You will find restaurants, shops and the beautiful Manotick Mill and Dickinson house a short walk away. The 416 highway access is 5 minutes away and downtown Ottawa is a 30 minute drive. You will have access to a private backyard deck and gazebo and front patio.

The space
You will have a private room with a comfortable King Size bed near the front door for convenience. There is a wardrobe with lots of space for your clothes, if needed. There is a small desk, coffee maker, kettle, TV tray, large smart TV with Rogers Infinite, wi-fi, a mini fridge, microwave, iron and small ironing board.
neighborhood_overview: Manotick is on the Rideau River and is surrounded by golf courses. There is public access for boating, kayaking, and canoeing. You can visit: Dickinson House, and Manotick Mill.  There are quaint restaurants, and coffee shops.  Please visit Miller's Oven for breakfast or lunch as it's very homey and run by volunteers.

description:
Dear Fellow Travelers,
Welcome to Ottawa, a city not only known as the capital but also a city of garden!
We have a house with large common area and spacious bedrooms available for guests. Whether you are here for Tulip Season, summer road-trip, autumn hike in Gatineau, winter skiing in MontTremblant, en-route to Montreal or Toronto, or just to experience arts & culture in downtown Ottawa, we can be your hot-spot! A friendly host, who's also a travel-lover, looks forward to welcoming you!

The space
- Expectation: this is not a professional hotel. It has a family atmosphere with a host who takes pride in welcoming guests and keeping the home clean and neat. You will be experiencing life-like-a-local during your stay.
- Great natural lighting in both bedrooms. Left Wing Bedroom is furnished with a double bed.
- Spacious common living room for mix&mingling, as well as for breakfast, coffee, and tea provided by the host to get your day started o
neighborhood_overview:
- safe and up-coming neighborhood of working professionals and families, close to school and shopping plazas
- Our favorite after-dinner stroll is along the neighborhood path that leads to Barrhaven Town Center, where we hit the bookstore and coffee shop. It's a big town center that has everything you need, such as grocery, restaurant, and cinema.

description:

Sparkling Clean: The unit has been thoroughly disinfected to ensure your peace of mind during the COVID-19 pandemic. The building's Property Management has taken a variety of daily cleaning measures.


Location Location Location: Your condo is one block away from the city's LRT transit system!

The space
Beautiful 1-bedroom suite on one of the top floors of this new luxurious high rise condo in the heart of downtown Ottawa.

Highlights: Enjoy a Queen-size bed, high speed wireless internet, a laptop friendly work space, 43” Smart TV including Netflix, and a private south-facing balcony with gorgeous city views from the 20th floor. All new stainless steel appliances including a fully equipped kitchen with all your essentials, in unit washer / dryer, dish
neighborhood_overview:
Free-on street parking on Slater St. is available after 6 pm and before 7 am on weekdays, and all day/evenings on weekends. However special parking rules may be in place during holiday weekends so read the signs carefully.

A 3-level paid parking garage is also conveniently located directly across the street (with access from 265 Laurier Ave West).

description:
Hello! Welcome to our home.

We have a lovely place with a bright and welcoming room just for you. The room is furnished with a comfortable double bed and a bedside table, closet, and cabinet. Towels are provided.

Your hosts are an accepting and progressive couple. People of all backgrounds, sexual orientations, and gender identities are welcome here. We expect acceptance and tolerance from our guests as well.

Please note that we have a dog in the house. She is vocal at first meeting.

The space
Please note that this room is within our house. We are a couple that reside there and there are two rooms listed on Airbnb: this room (The Ottawa Room) and The Barbados Room.

The bathroom, kitchen, and living areas are a shared space. There is a policy of mutual respect in the house. Noise is kept to a minimum, especially after 10:00pm. Signs of life, both visual and auditory, are to be expected in a shared environment. We do occa
neighborhood_overview: We live in a lovely, safe, and relatively quiet neighbourhood surrounded by parks and schools. There is a convenience store, coffee shop, and various restaurants (shwarma, pizza) a three minute walk away.

description:
A prime location lower level pied-à-terre on a quiet street in the centre of lively Westboro Village. Nestled in one of the original Westboro cottages, this fully renovated and appointed 850 square foot 2-bedroom guest suite features a separate entry for guests, living/dining area, kitchenette with laundry, and bathroom. Guests have use of back yard and deck. Get downtown in minutes by car, rapid transit or bike then come home to Westboro and slide into the neighbourhood vibe.

The space
Living/Dining area can reconfigure - sofa bed (double) opens to sleep two and table can expand to accommodate 6 diners. Kitchenette includes sink, fridge with freezer, two-burner hot plate, microwave, toaster oven, coffee maker, kettle, and all items to cook and serve 6.

Separate guest entrance is via the back yard.
Parking is available at no charge but requires coordination with resident hosts.

Guest access
You’ll have the space to yourself
neighborhood_overview:
The property is in the middle of a quiet street which coincidentally links up to all that Westboro has to offer.

A few steps to the South end is Ottawa’s premier pedestrian main street with the best of new restaurants, pubs, specialty coffee and shopping as well as MEC and the adventure outfitting retail cluster that accompanies it. Every convenience is also there in the way of pharmacy, post office, dry cleaning, health food stores, etc. Yoga studios abound and several churches are close. The Maplelawn heritage garden and historic manor house (with restaurant - best steaks in town) are also around the corner. The Byron linear park offers a fine walk about and is filled with the tastes and smiles of the outdoor Westboro food and farmers market every Saturday May through October.

A few steps to the North end and you come across the panoramic Ottawa river. Westboro beach is the best swimming spot in town, kayaks and canoes lay about with volleyball and movie nights

neighborhood_overview:
Overbook is a rapidly developing neighbourhood located in the east end of Ottawa. It is located across the Rideau River, from the neighbourhoods of Lower Town and Sandy Hill, just to the south Rockcliffe Park, and New Edinburgh.

Small-scale businesses line Donald Street on the neighbourhood's northern area. While the neighbourhood is quiet and residential, it is situated conveniently to St. Laurent Shopping Centre with anchors including Sears and The Bay, along with Bath and Body Works, Guess, SportChek, and many others. Nearby, you can also find The Ottawa Trainyards featuring WalMart and Marshall's. Even more shopping is available on both Montreal Road and Beechwood Avenue.

If you're looking for great Italian food, there is no shortage here in Overbrook. Louis' Restaurant and Pizzeria and Pizzaro's are two excellent, family-friendly restaurants centrally located in the neighbourhood.

description: Basement in-law suite literally a couple of blocks from both the Civic Hospital and Royal Ottawa Mental Health Hospital. Perfect for visiting professionals, family members of patients, or anyone looking for a self-contained place to stay in the centre of the City
neighborhood_overview:
Basement in-law suite literally a couple of blocks from both the Civic Hospital and Royal Ottawa Mental Health Hospital. Perfect for visiting professionals, family members of patients, or anyone looking for a self-contained place to stay in the centre of the City

The houses in this neighbourhood were built in the 1930s by David Younghusband (1883–1965), a local architect and building contractor. He was apparently a really tough person to work for, but he was one of the few employers who reliably kept people working during the Great Depression. None of the houses are exactly the same, but have many similar design features both inside and out.

The land that this house is built on used to be part of West End Park, which hosted Canada's debut performance of Thomas Edison's Vitascope (the first large screen moving picture) on July 21st, 1896. The outdoor auditorium where the Vitascope was exhibited spanned my back yard and that of my two neighbours to the North.

description:
Brand new one bedroom apartment in quiet mature residential neighbourhood. 20 minute walk to General and CHEO hospitals. Safe and friendly neighbourhood, with lots of trees.
Walking distance to grocery store, swimming, skating and library. Great location for single professional, medical student or medical resident. Close access to downtown for meetings.

The space
Fully furnished with 40 “ HD TV, internet with Wi-Fi and Ethernet. Full kitchen and appliances including dishwasher. Laundry: front load washer and dryer within unit. Heated floors throughout. Ironing board, hair dryer and first aid kit on site.

Guest access
Free parking is in front of the Unit.

Other things to note
We have done our best to sound proof the apartment but you will know there is life in the house above you. Expect some muffled footsteps when we are moving around. Quiet time is from 10:00 pm to 7:00 am. Note there is absolutely no smoking
neighborhood_overview: We are at the western edge of Elmvale acres in Ottawa's east end. There are bike lanes to take you down town to parliament, the Rideau canal and the Byward Market along Smyth-Main street and over the new Flora, Pretoria or Corktown footbridges. The trees, quiet walking and friendly disposition of the neighbourhood make it a wonderful place to live and visit. Several parks are a short walk away including; Lynda Lane, Playfair, Grasshopper Hill, Weston and Canterbury park. Several outdoor skating rinks at these parks in winter are great fun especially the outdoor covered Jim Tubman rink at Canterbury. Check the city listings for all these proximal recreational facilities.  See City of Ottawa Canterbury Recreation complex info on the web for details such as swim times, public skating, community activities etc.

Close to the highway, you're about 22 minute drive to Orleans or Kanata.
The house is newly renovated with in-suite laundry.

* 55" smart ROKU TV with Netflix
* Wifi
* Desk and chair in rooms
* Keurig coffee maker

please see guest access for details

The space
Welcome to your home away from home in Alta Vista !

This is a renovated cozy, bright main floor unit is perfect for any travelers. With three cozy Queen beds and a living room double sofa bed, the space comfortably sleeps up to eight guests.

Living room: Sofa, rocking chairs, foldable sofa bed and Smart TV with Netflix

Kitchen & Dining: Everything you need to cook up a great meal plus a coffee/tea
neighborhood_overview:
Alta Vista is a highly residential neighbourhood with a strong community, several schools, churches, and community centres. It also has a vast amount of greenspace and parks, much of which is part of the Alta Vista Transportation Corridor Environment.

The OC Transpo Transitway also runs through Alta Vista, with two stations in the neighbourhood itself (Pleasant Park and Riverside) as well as two just outside (Billings Bridge and Smyth), serving as a vital transit link to the rest of the city.

The General Campus of the Ottawa Hospital, and The Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario are located just on the north side of Smyth Road, in Riverview, while the Riverside Campus of the Ottawa Hospital is located at Smyth and Riverside Drive. There are two shopping malls in and around Alta Vista: the Billings Bridge Plaza Shopping Centre at Bank Street and Riverside and the Elmvale Shopping Centre at St. Laurent and Smyth.

neighborhood_overview:
Old Ottawa East is close to everything while still being quiet and safe. It's home to a relatively mature demographic, so not one of Ottawa's big student neighbourhoods. This booking comes with parking and is on two main bus routes.

It's on top of a coffee shop and bookstore, and steps away from a vegetarian restaurant that I would highly recommend. Very close to two grocery stores and an LCBO.

description:
Welcome to The North House! Our clean, comfortable and cozy rooms are located in the heart of the Kanata High Tech District. We are proud to offer a home away from home; the perfect place to unwind after a busy day of work, travel or recreation. Your stay includes a comfortable private bedroom and work-space; modern shared bathroom, high speed WIFI and home cooked meals for an additional cost. We look forward to making your stay as easy and peaceful as possible!

The space
Our home is a bright and inviting bungalow located on a corner lot in a quiet and convenient neighbourhood, directly next to extensive and beautiful walking and biking paths. This room is very spacious and private and has a small office nook. The clean and modern bathroom is located on the same floor. On the main floor you'll find the kitchen and laundry facilities. Outside feel free to use the shared patio and hot tub or relax in the basement rec room with our other travelling professionals.

The space

Guest access

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is both vibrant and diverse. ByWard market has seen much change in recent years and now boasts more local business development, including great restaurants, cafes, patios, shops and anything else you could need within a few steps.

The location is perfect for strolling through all what Ottawa has to offer to visitors and locals. Only 5 min walk to Parliament Hill.

Highlighted by The Boston Globe as being a very "cool 'hood" to visit. Named a top-ten neighbourhood nationwide by enRoute magazine. The Financial Times of London noted that the 'ByWard market is "thriving again" and the Ottawa Citizen, declared that "the changing nature of the neighbourhood is fascinating to watch... There is a hip, urban edge."

neighborhood_overview:
Alta Vista is its old-fashioned suburban feel coupled with its very close proximity to Ottawa’s downtown core. When you’re there, it’s hard to remember that bustling Bank Street is mere minutes away. If you’re looking for a neighbourhood with lots of trees, lots of parks, and where people say ‘hi’ to each other while out for a walk, this is it.

It’s a neighbourhood that prides itself on being safe, welcoming, and in close proximity to great schools.

description:
Welcome to a cheerful and casual room in the best neighbourhood in Ottawa!

Hintonburg is close to everything - downtown, the Ottawa River, the Rideau Canal, Westboro, Little Italy, and Chinatown - while having its own charming, walkable neighbourhood.

Hintonburg is known for its arts and culture, trendy restaurants and bars, farmer's market, charming coffee houses and bakeries, and vibrant community. It's also a practical neighbourhood with all the essentials in walking distance.

The space
You have a large attic-style bedroom in a character home on a quiet residential street just off the main street. The apartment comprises the second and third floors of the house. The bedrooms are on the third floor, making it easy to use the kitchen, bathroom, dining room, and living room without disturbing anyone's sleep. The apartment is not highly polished because it's an older home but it is clean, has heaps of character and is a comfortable oasis. <
neighborhood_overview:
It's hard to capture the awesomeness that is Hintonburg but here's a sampling:

Try free Saturday morning yoga in Parkdale Park - a 2 minute walk

Check out the Agircultural and Food Museum and pet friendly goats and sheep

Grab a mouth watering cronut and coffee at Art-Is-In-Bakery

Try a sampling of craft beers at Bar Lupulus - their menu changes constantly

Snuggle with kitties at the Feline Cafe

Immerse yourself in travel fantasy at World of Maps - a 2 minute walk

Go thrifting for local treasure at St. Vincent de Paul or a number of higher end boutique consignment shops

Wander down to the river and check out the balancing rock art at Remic Rapids

Take in a show at the Great Canadian Theatre Company

Get the best Vietnamese food at Saigon Boy in Chinatown

description:
Welcome to Michel Circle!

It is just minutes from downtown Ottawa, shopping, groceries, local swimming hole, restaurants, hiking trails, bike paths, and much more. It's your perfect getaway in the heart of the city where you will be able to de-stress after a busy day.

The space
A short drive or bus ride from the Byward Market and downtown, this is the perfect place for your stay in Ottawa. You will have a fully equipped kitchen with a dining area, a living room with TV, 2 bedrooms (2 double beds), a private washroom, WIFI+ parking for up to two vehicles.

neighborhood_overview:
Karen’s place is located in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.
We are just minutes walk or drive from:
- Shopping, groceries, cafés, pubs, and restaurants on Beechwood;
- Downtown Ottawa including Parliament Hill, National Art Gallery, Rideau Centre shopping mall, the Byward Market, the ByTowne Cinema, Rideau Canal, and the University of Ottawa;
- Natural treasures including historic Rockcliffe Park, a local swimming hole, fishing, NCC bike paths, and the Gatineau Hills.

Did you know? We have over 800 kilometers of bike paths in Ottawa! Check out the VeloGO bicycle rentals at the corner of Beechwood and Vanier Parkway and start your journey.

description:
Chambre privée entièrement meublée (ch #1 avec lit simple), pour location hebdomadaire ou mensuelle, à l'étage principal d'un magnifique bungalow situé dans le quartier francophone de Vanier, à 3km du Marché By. Idéal pour professionnels de passage, pied-à-terre ou étudiants internationaux qui recherchent une ambiance familiale chaleureuse, à la fois vivante et calme, et qui apprécient la présence d'un toutou affectueux!

The space
Complètement rénové en 2017, le logement complet est un bungalow avec 3 chambres à l'étage et 2 chambres au sous-sol. Chaque étage possède sa salle de bain complète. La salle principale avec un grand ilot, une table à manger et un air de repos est baignée de lumière et de bonnes énergies. Vous serez également charmé-e-s par le parc à quelques mètres (et forêt urbaine) où l'on peut se promener en toute saison. Notre maison est ouverte à la diversité et nous serons heureux d'accueillir des locataires de partout à travers le monde. De votr
neighborhood_overview: L'un des plus vieux quartiers d'Ottawa, Vanier est l'un des rares endroits où l'on retrouve encore des maisons uniques de style bungalow. Il s'y trouve un esprit de quartier et de famille authentique qu'on ne retrouve plus dans les quartiers plus modernes. La maison est située dans un secteur de Vanier bilingue (français et anglais) particulièrement calme et sécuritaire, avec peu de circulation. Les soirées y sont calmes et reposantes. Le jour, on y voit régulièrement, des poussettes, des vélos, des coureurs et des maîtres promener leur chien.

description:
We love to travel & host. We enjoy meeting people from all walks of life – and most importantly, creating spaces that are welcoming, comfortable and beautiful. We like to go above and beyond – and look forward to welcoming at our Cozy Oasis Floral bnb’s which are spacious, filled with amenities, and right in the heart of Centertown, a neighborhood surrounded by awesome food, vibes, and near a lot of Ottawa’s main attractions.

The space

description:
Full Home for those needing the space!

3 Full Bedrooms. Sleeps 6! Cozy, Clean, and Spacious! The perfect home away from home! Short Drive from Downtown Ottawa, Byward Market, Rideau Shopping Center, Rideau Canal, and Parliament Hill! GREAT place to discover Ottawa!

FREE Parking Included!

In addition to the essentials, this location is equipped with:
- SmartTV (Netflix!!!)
- Unlimited High Speed Internet
- Full Kitchen
- Washer/Dryer

Safe and happy travels!

The space
It has three separate bedrooms for three couples, friends, or parents with children. A wonderful living room area which offers a Smart TV that allows Netflix!

Additionally, a very functional kitchen with Granite Counter-tops, Stainless Steel Fridge/Stove, as well as Washer/Dryer. Don't settle for a tiny hotel room. This will give you comfort! WOW!

Guest access
The entire home is at your disposal. ENJOY!
neighborhood_overview:
THIS is where you want to be! Outside the downtown core's bustlingcrowds yet near everything Ottawa has to offer! It doesn't get any better.

Museums, museums, and more museums. This location has over a dozen museums in proximity (nature, war, postal, history, science & technology, agriculture, civilization, etc.)

Or, spend the day relaxing in one of the largest thermal spa in North America; Nordik Spa-Nature, situated under 30 minutes away. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Perhaps you'd like to try your luck against the one-armed-bandits? You are a short 15 minutes drive to the "Lac-Lemay" Casino in Hull!

Then, finish off by watching the sunset on a hilltop in the Gatineau Park.

These are just a few suggestions of activities to do during your time here. Once you book your stay with us, be sure to check out the Guestbook for more details and other "MUST-DO" items in Ottawa.

neighborhood_overview: New Edinburgh/Vanier North is a trendy neighbourhood full of artisan shops, fresh delicatessens, beautiful parks and home of the Governor General's residence. Make time for gourmet dining or a casual share plate at either Frasier's Cafe or Jaspers; both known for amazing, locally sourced, food and  hand-crafted cocktails. Take a stroll by the river or check out the falls at either Stanley Park or Rideau Falls Park. Take a tour of Rideau Hall- the Govenor General's residence or simply plan a picnic in the beautiful gardens and parks of the residence.

description:
An artful oasis in the heart of Ottawa’s Centretown neighbourhood.

ALLERGY ALERT: a cat has lives on the premises.

The space
A vintage-modern two-bedroom apartment with lots of natural light.

Relax in its open concept lounge, dine in the breakfast nook, pour yourself a glass of wine, put on a record, and dive into a coffee table book.

You are steps away from Centretown's adorable Dundonald Park, Chinatown, and a 12 minute walk to the Glebe, Golden Triangle. A 15-minute walk from Downtown, and the Hintonburg neighbourhoods.

Whether you want a quiet space to read, or want to socialize with locals, my apartment is surrounded by helpful friends/neighbours, always happy to meet travellers, and offer pro-tips for enjoying the city and our neighbourhood.

Guest access
All spaces except the basement are free to use.

description:
Main floor suite in a residential house.
Ten minute drive to the parliament/fifteen minute bus ride.
The suite has a queen bed, a balcony, a full kitchen, very bright, and a bathroom. Its fully private. Nothing is shared. Very clean!
Good location.

A private floor in a private house. Its a quiet house.
The place is NOT for people who want an apartment to party and have loud conversations. Please book somewhere else.
This is an apartment for guests who want privacy, and a quiet, clean stay.

The space
Not meant for partying, but enjoying the accommodation.
Very bright and extra clean. There is no television, however there is full wifi access.

It's eco friendly and recycling is encouraged.
For health reasons, there is no microwave. I am sorry.

If you are looking for peace and quiet, this place may be for you.
If you are loud and that's your nature, this place may not be for you.
neighborhood_overview:
Its just off Beechwood avenue, which is a ten minute drive from the parliament. Its a micro environment and is adjacent to Rockcliffe Park, where the Old Ottawa Bourgeoisie and locally placed Diplomats live. While the apartment is on the blue collar side of Beechwood Avenue, we all share the services on the street. Metro, which is a major grocery store is close by, across from which there is a smaller organic grocery store. Beechwood avenue has coffee shops, pubs, restaurants and some newer buildings being built.
The apartment itself is adjacent to Optimiste Park and is very quiet.
Its a three minute walk to Beechwood Avenue and ten minute drive to the parliament.
Its central, close to the centre, yet in a residential environment that is safe.
The bus can take you downtown in fifteen minutes or you can take a cab for around ten dollars.
Its central, yet safe.

description:
Enjoy a welcoming stay and relaxing sleep on a comfortable queen size bed. This elegant semi-detached home is located on a quiet cut de sac, steps from the Byward Market and across the street from a play park. The residence features neutral tones throughout, touches of blue, tasteful furnishings and decor, and access to an outdoor patio and BBQ.

The space
The main floor features a kitchen, dining and living room, with access to the outdoor patio and BBQ (for use from May to October).

The second floor has 2 bedrooms, a 4 piece bathroom and washer and dryer. Please note the stairs to the second floor are angled and you must be careful with children.

The third floor is an open concept loft style bedroom with ensuite, 3 piece bathroom. Please note the stairs to the third floor are without a railing.

The house is equipped with wifi, TV (access to Netflix, but no cable) and air conditioning.

description:
Large sunny room in the heart of Ottawa - 15 min walk to Parliament Hill and 5 min walk to the Rideau Canal- on a quiet street just off the bustling and hip Elgin St. This bedroom has a double bed its own private bathroom adjacent to the room, private balcony, desk, closet, mini fridge, microwave and kettle. A wonderful home for professionals in transition.

The space
There is mini fridge, microwave and kettle in the room. There is no access to kitchen facilities. This bedroom is on the 2nd floor and has the private bath adjacent to the room.

Two parking spaces (exterior) can be available upon request at the time of the booking for $120 month or $15 per day. Downtown parking is at a premium.

Guest access
Room, balcony and private bathroom (adjacent to the room).

No kitchen access.

Other things to note
We are taking extra steps to clean and sanitize frequently touched surfaces between reservation
neighborhood_overview:
5 min walk to famous Rideau Canal! The Golden Triangle, one of Ottawa's most desirable neighbourhoods, includes access to the Rideau Canal, the Rideau Centre, Elgin Street with its restaurants, cafes and clubs. It is a short walk to Parliament Hill and the Byward Market.
Tara is located in the quieter residential part of the GoldenTriangle.

description:
3 Bedroom Town House filled with natural light. Right across from Tanger outlets, 4 minutes to the Canadian Tire Centre, directly off the 417. Perfect for Sens games & concerts, vacationers, business travellers, and families. Enjoy a stress free self check in, no need to meet up or keep a strict schedule.

The space
The main floor is an open concept space with dark brown hardwood floors throughout. There is a 55’ smart TV with Netflix in the living area. The dining room table is a perfect work area to set up your laptop & enjoy the sun shining in from the back windows. The kitchen is fully equipped with cooking supplies, cutlery, & dining sets. Enjoy a cup of complimentary coffee from the Keurig in the “Coffee Corner”. Cream & sugar provided. There is a tea kettle & a variety of choices in the cupboard above the oven.

The master bedroom has a King sized bed with an en-suite washroom & walk in shower. The two guest bedrooms both have Queen sized beds an
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the newly built Minto Arcadia neighbourhood in the heart of Kanata directly off the 417. Minutes from all of the wonderful amenities Kanata has to offer.
Shop around at Tanger outlets, enjoy fine dining at one of the many restaurants in Kanata Centrum, or head over to the Canadian Tire Centre to catch a show or watch the Senators play. Downtown is just a quick 20 minute drive away on the Queen’s Way.

Close to lush green spaces such as the Carp River & the Feedmill creek. A 2 minute walk from the house sits a community park with a play structure, a basketball court, & a soccer field that is turned into a skating rink during the winter months.

description:

Located on the first floor, with a private entrance opening into the living/dining area, other rooms are the bedroom, bathroom & full kitchen with a back exit into the yard. Great for business travelers, couples & none sheddings furry friends (dogs). Breakfast goodies & snacks are​ left available to enjoy.

The space
Market Flat. Quite and comfy.
Located on the main floor of a six-unit building. There are 4 steps to the landing to access the private front door. where you walk into the living/dining room with also a work desk is also located. neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is a very family-friendly place.
Just around the corner through the dog park is the Govern Generals residence and Rideau Falls. The other direction you have the Market, Rideau shopping center, Galleries, Museums, and the Rideau Canal. In the summer you can rent paddleboards and other water toys. In the winter its the longest skating rink in the world. The closest ski resort is 15 minutes from the door. The flat is in a great fun spot for whatever you would like to do :)

description:
The Arc Studio is an all private studio with a private entrance in a townhome where each bedroom is a private apartment. Located in the east end of Ottawa, it’s by Petrie island beach and nature destination, 5 minutes walking distance to shopping complexes, trim station public transport, and it's off the queen's way; a 15-minute car ride to downtown(Ottawa University) when there's no traffic!

The space
We host a zen environment that is calm and positive. In the backyard there’s a peaceful park, while the interior is furnished with a cozy single day bed, that also has an aditional slide out single bed. The open concept kitchen has a butcher block with bar stools. The modern designs illustrate colourful zen paintings throughout the home, dark flooring accented with barn-wood and modern white furniture. The laundry room located in the lower level and is shared with everyone and is present with a Samsung washer and dryer.

Other things to note
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is quiet, calm, and upon a hill overlooking the Ottawa Valley and Gatineau Hills of the province of Quebec. Enjoy daily sunsets at the Petrie Island beach park by the Ottawa river, a popular destination to Ottawa. Explore a forest trail and a children's play park located across the back yard.

More information
There are numerous amenities placed within a 5-minute walking distance located at the shopping plaza including a Giant Tiger, Tim Hortons, Gabriel's Pizza, Subway, The Works Restaurant, The Johny Canuk's Bar & Grill, Starbucks, KFC and many more.

description:
River View Delight located in a quiet country style setting features a double bedroom space, fully furnished and decorated in soothing colours. The remainder of the suite features a shared eat-in kitchen, living room, and bathroom as well as a charming small patio with a bistro table and chairs. The view looks out over the Gatineau hills and the Ottawa River. A pleasant spot to enjoy nature.

Guest access
Guests will have use of the patio area and all common areas within the suite. Bedrooms are private space for use of the occupant only.
neighborhood_overview: Located on the eastern edges of the former village of Orleans, the neighbourhood offers more than just a suburban setting. There are lots of good quality restaurants and Orleans prides itself on being a 'foodie neighbourhood' from food trucks to great steaks and fusion delights. There are two cinemas, a theatre and arts centre with transit and shopping centre nearby. By all means our jewel is the Petrie Island Beach & wetlands area to hike, swim, fish, or visit the marina to pick up some bait or a cold drink. Other landmarks include the Cumberland Heritage Village, and the Cumberland Farmer's Market less than five minutes from our Airbnb. Orleans has a series of connected pathways for biking and walking as well as linking to Ottawa's downtown. Much to see, do and enjoy.

A spacious, clean and newly furnished apartment located in Ottawa’s Castle Heights (Vanier South). Centrally located from downtown, shopping centers, restaurants and grocery stores so you’ll have everything you need during your stay. A 10 minute drive from the Byward Market and with a bus stop right around the corner, you're footsteps away from experiencing everything Ottawa has to offer! Whether you're staying for a weekend or two weeks, this is your perfect home away from home!

The space
This spacious 2 bedroom unit that has brand new furniture, 2 parking spots and all the amenities you can imagine! In the master bedroom you’ll find a comfortable queen size bed and in the second bedroom you’ll find a cozy full size bed. You'll have access to a full range of cookwa

There is the St Laurent Shopping Centre minutes away as well as Ottawa's Byward Market and Parliament Hill a short Uber or bus ride away. There are some great areas to go for a walk along the Rideau River which you can cross and explore the Sandy Hill neighbourhood of Ottawa.

description:
★ 4 bedrooms (10 beds)
★ Well equipped kitchen
★ Nice backyard with BBQ
★ Central location with free parking

The space
This property is a two level home. On the main floor you will find the living room, kitchen, dining room, washer and dryer, and powder room. This space will be perfect for preparing and enjoying meal. The living room is spacious and will be the perfect place for you and your group to put your feet up.

The top floor is where you will find the 4 large bedrooms and the full bathroom. Each bedroom has been designed with maximising space and keeping the cost of each traveller as low as possible. In each room you will fin one queen bed and a bunk bed. The bunk beds are a queen bed on the bottom and a single on top.

The Vanier Community Church is only minutes away.

The Great Canadian Poutinerie - Poutine is a great place to get warmed up during our winter months.

The Shoppers Drug Mart is only a few blocks a away for all your pharmaceutical needs.

The Metro is the closest grocery store in the area at only 3 minutes away!

One of the bedrooms has a king bed (Novosbed firm) and the other a queen and are located on the second floor. The third is in the basement and has a double size inflatable mattress. There is free laundry in the basement if you need. Please note that this is our living space (we won't be there) so there is no closet space nor empty drawers available.

There is even an office with a desk, monitor, keyboard and mouse if you want to plug in your laptop to work.

This is a queer friendly space.

Guest access
You get the entire house.

neighborhood_overview:
Vanier is a historically French-Canadian neighbourhood just a few kilometres east of downtown Ottawa. In this residential area, you can visit an urban sugar shack, browse at a farmers’ market, cycle along the Rideau River or visit a museum celebrating the neighbourhood’s storied past.

Vanier is home to a wide range of independent shops, mainly along Montreal Road in the heart of the neighbourhood and lively Beechwood Avenue on Vanier’s northern edge. The Beechwood Market in Optimiste Park is a fun place to shop for local products from June through October.

description:
This beautifully updated Westboro home is steps away from fabulous restaurants, unique shops and cozy cafes. Spend your days exploring the vibrant and trendy neighbourhood, or head into downtown Ottawa (less than a 10 min drive to Parliament Hill). In the summer, take full advantage of the private swimming pool, and in winter cozy up with a good book or cable TV in the den with pullout couch. Note the homeowners live in the private basement suite with its own entrance.

The space
6 can sleep comfortably (5 adults + 1 child) in two bedrooms plus den. Twin beds, one queen, and a pullout sofa in the den with gas fireplace ensure a great night's sleep, ready to attack the day touring Ottawa, Gatineau or exploring a variety of day trips in the capital region. Note the master bedroom with queen bed has its own TV, as does the den with pullout sofa (no sight or sound privacy here as this is a separate living area with no door). There is no TV in the main living room.

neighborhood_overview:
THIS is where you want to be! Right near the Bywards Market and everything Ottawa has to offer! It doesn't get any better.

Museums, museums, and more museums. This location has over a dozen museums in proximity (nature, war, postal, history, science & technology, agriculture, civilization, etc.)

Or, spend the day relaxing in the largest thermal spa in North America; Nordik Spa-Nature, situated only 10 minutes away.

Perhaps you'd like to try your luck against the one-armed-bandits? You are a short 15 minutes drive to the "Lac-Lemay" Casino in Hull!

Then, finish off by watching the sunset on a hilltop in the Gatineau Park.

These are just a few suggestions of activities to do during your time here.

Just 5 minute walk from grocery store (Loblaws), nearby convenience stores, LCBO and restaurants etc.

neighborhood_overview:
Kanata is one of the largest suburbs of Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. It is about 22 km (14 mi) west of the city's downtown and is growing rapidly.

Before it was amalgamated into Ottawa in 2001, it was one of the fastest growing cities in Canada and the fastest growing community in Eastern Ontario.

Located just to the west of the National Capital Commission Greenbelt, it is one of the largest of several communities that surround central Ottawa. It is a planned community and an important high tech centre.

description:
We have a comfortable two-bedroom home for four people maximum in a prime central location. A short walk from cafes, restaurants and shops... 3 blocks to the World Heritage site Rideau Canal (world's largest skating rink in winter, boating in summer) and 3 blocks to the Rideau River (outdoor skating and hockey rinks in winter, tennis courts and playground in other seasons). The Parliament Buildings, National Arts Centre, Nature Museum, and National Gallery are all 30 minutes walk or closer.

The space
We have parking space for one car in the driveway. It's a 12 minute walk to the city's light rail transit line. Our large kitchen is connected (open concept) to the living room and looks out on our private back yard. Besides two bedrooms with queen sized beds, we have a study overlooking the back yard with two desks and a love seat. A footbridge over the canal takes you to the historic brownstone Glebe neighbourhood with lots of shopping and dining. Ottawa combine
neighborhood_overview: The city's most popular vegetarian restaurant is around the corner. So is a pharmacy, a bookstore, a fusion taco restaurant, an Italian food store, a popular local chain coffee shop, a British-style pub, and a packaging-free grocery store. Five blocks takes you to a beautiful riverside park with tennis, playgrounds, boat launch, and in the winter, outdoor skating.  A nearby footbridge across the canal links you to the Glebe neighbourhood, with dozens of shops, restaurants, and cafes along popular Bank Street.  Elgin Street, with several pubs and restaurants is also close by. Further up the canal is Ottawa's downtown core, with several architectural gems including the Parliament Buildings, the historic Chateau Laurier Hotel, The Byward market, and the National Gallery of Canada.

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located at Glebe, which is one of the most leafy and historic neighbourhood, situated south of Ottawa's downtown area in the Capital Ward with its northern border being demarcated by Highway 417, the Queensway. It is bounded by the Rideau Canal to the south and east.

The stretch of Bank Street that runs through the Glebe is one of Ottawa's premier shopping areas, with many small stores and restaurants offering a wide variety of services. The Glebe is home to Lansdowne Park which contains TD Place Stadium, where Ottawa's Canadian Football League (CFL) football team and the University of Ottawa Gee-Gees play their home games.

Source: Wikipedia

description:
Bella Notte B&B is located in the heart of downtown Ottawa, in a restored heritage house built in 1868 for Sir Alexander Campbell - one of Canada’s fathers of Confederation. A true monument to Ottawa’s history, Bella Notte B&B is now lovingly restored to its 19th century splendour with modern and artistic flair. Located walking distance to all main attractions, yet on a quiet residential street, Bella Notte B&B is the perfect destination for business and pleasure.

The space
Our quaint, boutique size allows us to provide each guest with personalized service and our unforgettable breakfast will be the highlight of your stay. Not offered anywhere else, our freshly made breakfast is also served with live jazz piano.

Other things to note
Bella Notte B&B is featured in Lonely Planet Canada under author's choice!
neighborhood_overview:
Bella Notte’s ideal location in the historic neighbourhood of Sandy Hill puts you in the middle of the action yet away from the bustle of the busy main streets. We are less than a 5 minute walk from the Byward Market - Ottawa’s downtown mecca for dinning, fashion, nightlife, culture and cutting edge trends. The Rideau Canal - now a UNESCO World Heritage Site - is the word’s longest skating rink in the winter and a beautiful destination for a sunset boat tour in the summer. Ottawa is also the lucky host to many of Canada’s National Galleries and Museums, all of which are a short walk away.

For those heading to Ottawa on business, Bella Notte is also 5 minutes walking distance from the newly renovated Shaw Conference Centre (formally known as the Congress Centre). You will find yourself at the University of Ottawa campus literally steps after leaving the front door, and many Federal office buildings are a short walk across the canal.
